recipes.description: A quick and flavorful soup with all the taste of tacos, perfect for a weeknight.
ingredients: 1 (10 oz) can diced tomatoes with green chilies (e.g., Ro*Tel), undrained (check carbs)
Optional: 4 oz cream cheese, cubed (for creaminess)
Toppings: Shredded cheddar cheese, sour cream, avocado, cilantro
instructions: In a large pot or Dutch oven, brown the ground beef and onion over medium heat until meat is cooked through. Drain any excess fat.
Stir in the taco seasoning.
Add beef broth and the can of diced tomatoes with green chilies. Bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat to low and cook for 15-20 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
If using cream cheese for a creamy version, stir it in during the last 5 minutes until melted and smooth.
Ladle into bowls and serve hot with desired toppings like cheese, sour cream, and avocado. Kids can choose their own toppings!
recipes.notes: Recipe 083 - Taco Soup (Easy Weeknight) - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Broccoli Slaw with Creamy Dressing
recipes.description: A crunchy and tangy slaw that's a great side dish.
ingredients: 1 (12 oz) bag broccoli slaw mix (or make your own with shredded broccoli stems, carrots, and red cabbage - use carrots sparingly)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: 1/4 cup unsalted sunflower seeds or chopped pecans
instructions: In a large bowl, place the broccoli slaw mix.
In a small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, apple cider vinegar, and sweetener until smooth.
Pour the dressing over the broccoli slaw. Toss to combine thoroughly.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
If using, stir in sunflower seeds or pecans.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 20-30 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld. This is often a hit at family meals.
recipes.notes: Recipe 084 - Broccoli Slaw with Creamy Dressing - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Cheeseburger Salad
recipes.description: All the best parts of a cheeseburger in a fresh, satisfying salad.
ingredients: 4 cups chopped romaine lettuce or mixed greens
1 tablespoon dill pickle relish or finely chopped dill pickles
instructions: Cook the ground beef in a skillet over medium heat until browned. Drain excess fat. Stir in Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper.
Prepare the Special Sauce Dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, sugar-free ketchup, pickle relish/chopped pickles, mustard, and garlic powder. Set aside.
In a large salad bowl (or individual bowls), arrange the lettuce/mixed greens.
Top with the cooked ground beef, shredded cheddar cheese, chopped dill pickles, and red onion (if using).
Drizzle with the Special Sauce Dressing. Toss gently if desired, or serve dressing on the side.
Kids often enjoy the familiar cheeseburger flavors.
recipes.notes: Recipe 085 - Cheeseburger Salad - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Creamy Cucumber and Radish Salad
recipes.description: A crisp and refreshing salad with a light, creamy dressing.
ingredients: 1/4 cup sour cream or full-fat Greek yogurt
1 tablespoon fresh dill, chopped (or 1 tsp dried)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine sliced cucumber and sliced radishes.
In a small bowl, whisk together sour cream (or Greek yogurt), dill, and lemon juice.
Pour the dressing over the cucumbers and radishes. Toss gently to coat.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cover and chill for at least 15 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld. A simple side that complements many meals.
recipes.notes: Recipe 086 - Creamy Cucumber and Radish Salad - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: One-Pan Sausage and Veggie Bake
recipes.description: A super easy and customizable sheet pan meal, perfect for busy weeknights.
ingredients: 1-1.5 lbs smoked sausage (kielbasa or similar, check for low sugar), sliced into 1/2-inch rounds
1 medium head of broccoli, cut into florets
1 red bell pepper, cored, seeded, and chopped
1/4 cup olive oil or avocado oil
1 teaspoon Italian seasoning or your favorite herbs (rosemary, thyme)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper for easy cleanup.
In a large bowl, combine sliced sausage, broccoli florets, chopped bell pepper, and chopped zucchini.
Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with Italian seasoning, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Toss well to coat everything evenly.
Spread the sausage and vegetables in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.
Roast for 20-25 minutes, stirring or flipping halfway through, until vegetables are tender-crisp and sausage is heated through and lightly browned.
Serve immediately. This is a great way for kids to eat their veggies!
recipes.notes: Recipe 087 - One-Pan Sausage and Veggie Bake - Main Course

recipes.name: Chicken Nugget Bites (Almond Flour)
recipes.description: Kid-approved crispy chicken nuggets made with almond flour, baked or air-fried.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into 1-inch nugget-sized pieces
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: Cooking spray or olive oil for baking/air frying
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper, or preheat air fryer to 375°F (190°C).
Pat chicken pieces dry with paper towels.
In a shallow dish or plate, combine almond flour, Parmesan cheese, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
In another shallow dish, place the beaten eggs.
Dip each chicken piece into the beaten egg, allowing excess to drip off.
Then, dredge the chicken piece in the almond flour mixture, pressing gently to ensure it's well coated.

Place coated chicken pieces in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet or in the air fryer basket (you may need to work in batches for air fryer). Lightly spray with cooking spray or drizzle with oil if desired for extra crispiness.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, flipping halfway, or air fry for 10-15 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden brown, crispy, and cooked through (internal temperature of 165°F or 74°C).
Serve warm with keto-friendly dipping sauces like sugar-free ketchup or ranch.
recipes.notes: Recipe 088 - Chicken Nugget Bites (Almond Flour) - Main Course

recipes.name: Mini Meatloaf Muffins
recipes.description: Individual-sized meatloaves baked in muffin tins for quick cooking and easy serving. Kid-friendly!
ingredients: 1.5 lbs ground beef (or a mix of beef and pork)
1/2 cup almond flour or crushed pork rinds
2 tablespoons sugar-free ketchup or tomato paste
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional Topping: A little extra sugar-free ketchup for each muffin
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease a 12-cup standard muffin tin.

In a large bowl, gently combine ground beef, almond flour/pork rinds, chopped onion, beaten egg, ketchup/tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. Be careful not to overmix, as this can make the meatloaf tough.
Divide the meat mixture evenly among the prepared muffin cups.
If desired, spread a small amount of additional sugar-free ketchup on top of each mini meatloaf.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 160°F (71°C).
Let cool in the muffin tin for a few minutes before carefully removing. Serve warm.
recipes.notes: Recipe 089 - Mini Meatloaf Muffins - Main Course

recipes.name: Deconstructed Egg Roll in a Bowl
recipes.description: All the delicious flavors of an egg roll without the wrapper, quick and easy for a weeknight.
ingredients: 1 lb ground pork or beef (or chicken/turkey)
1 tablespoon sesame oil or avocado oil
1 (14-16 oz) bag coleslaw mix (shredded cabbage and carrots)
1/4 cup soy sauce or coconut aminos
Optional: Sriracha or red pepper flakes to taste for heat
Optional garnish: Sliced green onions, sesame seeds
instructions: Heat sesame oil or avocado oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add ground pork/beef and onion. Cook, breaking up the meat, until browned and onion is softened. Drain any excess fat.
Stir in minced garlic and grated ginger. Cook for 1 minute more until fragrant.
Add the coleslaw mix to the skillet. Cook, stirring frequently, for 5-7 minutes, or until the cabbage is wilted and tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce/coconut aminos and rice vinegar. Pour over the mixture in the skillet.
Stir well to combine and heat through for another 1-2 minutes.
Add Sriracha or red pepper flakes if desired for heat.
Serve hot in bowls, garnished with sliced green onions and sesame seeds if desired. A family favorite!
recipes.notes: Recipe 090 - Deconstructed Egg Roll in a Bowl - Main Course

recipes.name: Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Fat Bombs
recipes.description: Satisfy your cookie dough cravings with these easy no-bake fat bombs.
instructions: In a medium bowl, beat together softened butter and cream cheese with an electric mixer until smooth and fluffy.
Beat in almond flour, powdered sweetener, vanilla extract, and salt until well combined.
Gently fold in the sugar-free chocolate chips.
Chill the mixture in the refrigerator for about 20-30 minutes to firm up slightly.
Roll the 'dough' into small balls (about 1 inch in diameter).
Place on a parchment-lined plate and freeze for at least 30 minutes, or until firm.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer. These are a huge hit!
recipes.notes: Recipe 091 - Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Fat Bombs - Desserts

recipes.name: Peanut Butter Mousse
recipes.description: A light, airy, and creamy peanut butter mousse that's quick to whip up.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons keto-friendly powdered sweetener (or to taste)
Optional: Sugar-free chocolate shavings or chopped peanuts for topping
instructions: In a chilled mixing bowl, beat the heavy whipping cream with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form.
In a separate small bowl, whisk together peanut butter, powdered sweetener, and vanilla extract until smooth. If it's too thick, you can add a tablespoon of the whipped cream to loosen it.
Gently fold the peanut butter mixture into the whipped cream until just combined and no streaks remain. Be careful not to overmix and deflate the cream.
Spoon the mousse into small serving dishes or glasses.
Chill for at least 15-30 minutes before serving to allow it to set further, or serve immediately.
Top with sugar-free chocolate shavings or chopped peanuts if desired.
recipes.notes: Recipe 092 - Peanut Butter Mousse - Desserts

recipes.name: Lemon Fat Bombs
recipes.description: Bright and zesty lemon fat bombs, a refreshing treat.
ingredients: 1/2 cup coconut oil, softened but not melted
2-3 tablespoons keto-friendly powdered sweetener (e.g., erythritol), to taste
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine softened coconut oil, softened butter, lemon zest, lemon juice, and powdered sweetener.
Beat with an electric mixer (or stir vigorously) until well combined and fluffy.
If using, stir in the shredded coconut.
Taste and adjust sweetener or lemon juice if needed.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto a parchment-lined plate or use mini muffin liners/silicone molds.
Freeze for at least 30-60 minutes, or until firm.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer.
recipes.notes: Recipe 093 - Lemon Fat Bombs - Desserts

recipes.name: Chocolate Covered Strawberries (Sugar-Free)
recipes.description: A simple and elegant dessert using fresh strawberries and sugar-free chocolate.
ingredients: 1 pint fresh strawberries, washed and thoroughly dried
1 teaspoon coconut oil (optional, helps with smoothness)
instructions: Line a baking sheet or plate with parchment paper.
Ensure strawberries are completely dry, as water can cause the chocolate to seize.

In a microwave-safe bowl or a double boiler, melt the sugar-free chocolate chips with the coconut oil (if using). Microwave in 20-30 second intervals, stirring in between, until smooth. Be careful not to overheat.
Holding each strawberry by the stem or leaves, dip it into the melted chocolate, leaving a little bit of the red showing near the top, or dip as much as you like.
Allow any excess chocolate to drip off.
Place the chocolate-covered strawberries on the prepared parchment paper.
Refrigerate for at least 15-30 minutes, or until the chocolate is set.
Serve chilled. Best enjoyed within 1-2 days.
recipes.notes: Recipe 094 - Chocolate Covered Strawberries (Sugar-Free) - Desserts

recipes.name: Creamy Orange Refresher
recipes.description: A light and creamy orange drink, reminiscent of a creamsicle.
ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., liquid stevia or erythritol)
instructions: Combine almond/coconut milk, heavy cream, orange extract, sweetener, and vanilla extract (if using) in a blender or a shaker cup.
Add ice cubes.
Blend or shake well until smooth and frothy.
Taste and adjust sweetener or orange extract if needed.
Pour into a glass and serve immediately. Kids might enjoy this 'orange creamy' drink.
recipes.notes: Recipe 095 - Creamy Orange Refresher - Drinks

recipes.name: Berry Infused Iced Green Tea
recipes.description: A refreshing iced green tea naturally sweetened and flavored with berries.
ingredients: 2-3 green tea bags (or 2-3 teaspoons loose leaf green tea)
4 cups hot water (not boiling, around 175°F or 80°C for green tea)
1/2 cup mixed berries (strawberries, raspberries, blueberries), fresh or frozen
Optional: Lemon slices or mint for garnish
instructions: Steep green tea bags/loose tea in hot water for 3-5 minutes. Do not oversteep green tea, as it can become bitter. Remove tea bags or strain loose tea.
While the tea is warm, add the mixed berries. Gently muddle them slightly to release their juices if desired.
Add sweetener now if using, while the tea is warm, to help it dissolve.
Let the tea cool to room temperature, then refrigerate for at least 1-2 hours to chill and allow flavors to infuse further.
Strain out the berries if you prefer a clear tea, or leave them in.
Serve over ice, garnished with lemon slices or mint if desired.
recipes.notes: Recipe 096 - Berry Infused Iced Green Tea - Drinks

recipes.name: Warm Spiced Almond Milk
recipes.description: A comforting and lightly spiced warm drink, perfect before bed.
ingredients: Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., stevia or erythritol)
instructions: In a small saucepan, combine unsweetened almond milk, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cardamom (if using).
Heat over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until warm. Do not boil.
Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla extract and sweetener to taste.
Pour into a mug and serve warm. A lovely, simple drink for kids too (adjust spices to their preference).
recipes.notes: Recipe 097 - Warm Spiced Almond Milk - Drinks

recipes.name: Lemon Ginger Detox Water
recipes.description: A simple and cleansing infused water with lemon and ginger.
ingredients: 1-inch piece of fresh ginger, thinly sliced or grated
Optional: A few mint leaves or cucumber slices
instructions: In a large pitcher, combine sliced lemon and sliced/grated ginger.
Add mint leaves or cucumber slices if desired.
Pour cold filtered water over the ingredients.
Stir gently.
Refrigerate for at least 1-2 hours to allow flavors to infuse. Can be infused overnight for stronger flavor.
Serve chilled. Great for hydration throughout the day.
recipes.notes: Recipe 098 - Lemon Ginger Detox Water - Drinks

recipes.name: Peanut Butter Cup Fat Bombs
recipes.description: Classic peanut butter cup flavor in a small, satisfying keto treat.
instructions: Line a mini muffin tin with paper liners (you'll need about 12-15).
Prepare the Peanut Butter Layer: In a small bowl, combine peanut butter, melted coconut oil, powdered sweetener, and salt. Stir until smooth.
Spoon about 1 teaspoon of the peanut butter mixture into the bottom of each mini muffin liner.
Freeze for 10-15 minutes to set the peanut butter layer.
Prepare the Chocolate Layer: In a microwave-safe bowl or small saucepan, melt sugar-free chocolate chips with 1 tablespoon of coconut oil until smooth. Stir well.
Spoon a layer of the melted chocolate over the set peanut butter layer in each muffin liner.
Return to the freezer for at least 20-30 minutes, or until completely firm.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer. These are a fantastic fat bomb option!
recipes.notes: Recipe 099 - Peanut Butter Cup Fat Bombs - Desserts

recipes.name: Cheese Stuffed Celery Sticks
recipes.description: A super simple and crunchy snack using pimento cheese or herbed cream cheese.
ingredients: 4-5 celery stalks, washed and cut into 3-4 inch pieces
1/2 cup pimento cheese (check for low sugar) or herbed cream cheese
Optional: Sprinkle of paprika or black pepper
instructions: Ensure celery sticks are dry.
Carefully spread or pipe the pimento cheese or herbed cream cheese into the groove of each celery stick.
Sprinkle with paprika or black pepper if desired.
Serve immediately or chill for a bit. A very quick and easy snack that many kids enjoy.
recipes.notes: Recipe 100 - Cheese Stuffed Celery Sticks - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Cucumber and Cream Cheese Bites with Everything Seasoning
recipes.description: Refreshing cucumber rounds topped with cream cheese and a sprinkle of everything bagel seasoning.
ingredients: 1 large cucumber, sliced into 1/3-inch thick rounds
instructions: Pat the cucumber slices dry with a paper towel.
Spread a small amount of softened cream cheese onto each cucumber slice.
Sprinkle generously with Everything Bagel Seasoning.
Arrange on a platter and serve. These are great for a quick snack or light appetizer.
recipes.notes: Recipe 101 - Cucumber and Cream Cheese Bites with Everything Seasoning - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Almond Joy Fat Bombs
recipes.description: Delicious fat bombs that taste just like an Almond Joy candy bar.
ingredients: 1/4 teaspoon almond extract (optional, for stronger almond flavor)
Optional: 2 tablespoons sugar-free chocolate chips, melted for drizzle
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine softened coconut oil, shredded coconut, almond butter, powdered sweetener, almond extract (if using), and vanilla extract. Mix well until smooth.
Chill the mixture for 10-15 minutes if it's too soft to handle.
Scoop out tablespoon-sized portions of the mixture. Press a whole almond into the center of each portion and roll into a ball around the almond.
Place the formed fat bombs on a parchment-lined plate.
If desired, drizzle with melted sugar-free chocolate chips.
Freeze for at least 30 minutes, or until firm.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer. A delightful sweet treat!
recipes.notes: Recipe 102 - Almond Joy Fat Bombs - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Pepperoni Pizza Bites (Muffin Tin)
recipes.description: Mini pizza bites made in a muffin tin with a cheesy base, perfect for kids and parties.
ingredients: 2-3 tablespoons keto-friendly marinara or pizza sauce (no sugar added)
Optional: Mini pepperoni or other finely chopped keto pizza toppings
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Grease a 12-cup mini muffin tin (or a standard one for larger bites, you'll make fewer).
In a bowl, combine shredded mozzarella, Parmesan cheese, beaten egg, and Italian seasoning. Mix well.
Press about 1 tablespoon of the cheese mixture into the bottom of each mini muffin cup to form a base.
Top the cheese base with 1-2 slices of pepperoni (or mini pepperoni).
Add a very small dollop (about 1/4 teaspoon) of marinara/pizza sauce on top of the pepperoni.
Add another slice of pepperoni or a sprinkle of more cheese/toppings if desired.
Bake for 8-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden, cheese is melted and bubbly, and pepperoni is slightly crispy.
Let cool in the muffin tin for a few minutes before carefully removing. Serve warm. These are always a hit!
recipes.notes: Recipe 103 - Pepperoni Pizza Bites (Muffin Tin) - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Cloud Eggs (Egg Nests)
recipes.description: Fluffy baked egg whites topped with a runny yolk, a fun way to eat eggs.
ingredients: 4 large eggs, separated (yolks kept intact in individual small bowls)
1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese (or other hard cheese)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: Chopped chives or a pinch of paprika for garnish
instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a clean, dry mixing bowl, beat the egg whites with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold in the grated Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper into the stiff egg whites.
Spoon four large mounds of the egg white mixture onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing them apart.
Use the back of a spoon to create a small well or indent in the center of each egg white mound.
Bake the egg white clouds for 3-4 minutes, until they are lightly golden and set.
Carefully remove the baking sheet from the oven. Gently place one egg yolk into the well of each egg white cloud.
Return to the oven and bake for another 2-3 minutes, or until the yolks are warmed through but still runny (or cooked to your preference).
Serve immediately, garnished with chives or paprika if desired. Kids find these visually appealing!
recipes.notes: Recipe 104 - Cloud Eggs (Egg Nests) - Breakfast

recipes.name: Chocolate Chia Pudding Parfait
recipes.description: A decadent-tasting but healthy layered breakfast or dessert.
ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk
1/4 cup keto-friendly whipped cream (homemade or sugar-free store-bought)
Optional: Sugar-free chocolate shavings or chopped nuts
instructions: Prepare the Chocolate Chia Pudding: In a jar or bowl, whisk together chia seeds, almond/coconut milk, cocoa powder, sweetener, and vanilla extract until well combined and no lumps remain.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2-3 hours, or preferably overnight, until thick and pudding-like. Stir once or twice during the first hour to prevent clumping.
Assemble Parfaits: In a small glass or jar, layer the chocolate chia pudding with keto whipped cream and a few berries.
Repeat layers if your glass is tall enough.
Top with a final dollop of whipped cream, a few more berries, and optional chocolate shavings or nuts.
Serve chilled. This can be a fun breakfast for kids when presented as a parfait.
recipes.notes: Recipe 105 - Chocolate Chia Pudding Parfait - Breakfast

recipes.name: Bacon and Egg Cups
recipes.description: Crispy bacon forms a cup for a perfectly baked egg, great for grab-and-go.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).

Line each cup of a 12-cup standard muffin tin with a slice of bacon, forming a cup or nest shape. The bacon can overlap. (For crispier bacon, you can partially cook the bacon slices for a few minutes before lining the muffin cups, then drain).
Carefully crack one egg into each bacon-lined muffin cup.
Season with salt and pepper.
If desired, sprinkle a little shredded cheese or chopped chives on top of each egg.
Bake for 12-18 minutes, depending on how runny you like your egg yolks. For firmer yolks, bake longer.
Let cool in the muffin tin for a few minutes. Carefully run a knife around the edges to loosen, then remove the bacon and egg cups.
Serve warm. These are a hit with kids and great for meal prep.
recipes.notes: Recipe 106 - Bacon and Egg Cups - Breakfast

recipes.name: Cinnamon Swirl Chaffles
recipes.description: Chaffles with a delightful cinnamon swirl, perfect for a sweet breakfast treat.
instructions: Preheat your mini waffle maker (chaffle maker).
Prepare the Chaffle Batter: In a small bowl, beat the egg. Stir in the shredded mozzarella cheese and almond flour (if using) until well combined.
Prepare the Cinnamon Swirl: In another small bowl, mix together melted butter, sweetener, and ground cinnamon.
Grease the waffle maker if necessary. Pour about half of the chaffle batter into the preheated waffle maker.
Drizzle about half of the cinnamon swirl mixture over the batter in the waffle maker.
Cook for 3-5 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Carefully remove the chaffle and repeat with the remaining batter and cinnamon swirl mixture.
Serve warm. Can be topped with a little extra butter or keto-friendly cream cheese frosting.
recipes.notes: Recipe 107 - Cinnamon Swirl Chaffles - Breakfast

recipes.name: Simple Egg Salad (Kid-Friendly)
recipes.description: A basic and mild egg salad that's perfect for kids' sandwiches (on keto bread) or lettuce wraps.
ingredients: 6 large hard-boiled eggs, peeled and roughly chopped
1/4 cup mayonnaise (check for no added sugar)
1 teaspoon yellow mustard (optional, for mild flavor)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: Finely chopped celery for a little crunch (1-2 tablespoons)
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine the chopped hard-boiled eggs and mayonnaise.
Add yellow mustard (if using) and finely chopped celery (if using).
Gently stir to combine all ingredients. Be careful not to mash the eggs too much if you prefer a chunkier salad.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately or chill for later. Great in lettuce cups or with cucumber slices for dipping.
recipes.notes: Recipe 108 - Simple Egg Salad (Kid-Friendly) - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Italian Chopped Salad with Lemon Vinaigrette
recipes.description: A bright and flavorful chopped salad with Italian meats, cheeses, and a zesty lemon dressing.
ingredients: 1/4 cup cherry tomatoes, halved (optional, use sparingly)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Prepare the Lemon Vinaigrette: In a small bowl or jar, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
In a large salad bowl, combine chopped romaine lettuce, salami, provolone cheese, black olives, pepperoncini, and cherry tomatoes (if using).
Pour the lemon vinaigrette over the salad ingredients.
Toss well to ensure everything is evenly coated.
Serve immediately. This salad is colorful and appealing.
recipes.notes: Recipe 109 - Italian Chopped Salad with Lemon Vinaigrette - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Chicken Caesar Lettuce Wraps
recipes.description: A quick and easy no-cook meal using crisp lettuce cups instead of bread.
ingredients: 2 cups cooked and shredded or diced chicken (rotisserie chicken works well)
1/2 cup keto Caesar dressing (store-bought or homemade)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste (if needed)
8-12 large romaine or butter lettuce leaves, washed and dried
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine the shredded/diced chicken, Caesar dressing, and grated Parmesan cheese.
Mix well until the chicken is evenly coated. Season with salt and pepper if your dressing isn't seasoned enough.
Spoon the chicken Caesar mixture into the prepared lettuce leaves, using them as wraps or cups.
Serve immediately. A simple and refreshing meal that kids can help assemble.
recipes.notes: Recipe 110 - Chicken Caesar Lettuce Wraps - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Tomato and Mozzarella Caprese Bites
recipes.description: Simple, fresh, and classic. Perfect as a light salad or appetizer.
ingredients: 1 pint cherry or grape tomatoes, halved
8 oz fresh mozzarella pearls (ciliegine), or small mozzarella balls, halved
1/4 cup fresh basil leaves, chiffonade (thinly sliced) or torn
1 tablespoon balsamic glaze (optional, ensure low carb or make keto version)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: In a medium bowl, gently combine halved tomatoes and halved mozzarella pearls.
Add the fresh basil.
Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and balsamic glaze (if using).
Season lightly with salt and pepper.
Toss gently to combine.
Serve immediately or let marinate for 10-15 minutes for flavors to meld. Kids often enjoy the mild cheese and sweet tomatoes.
recipes.notes: Recipe 111 - Tomato and Mozzarella Caprese Bites - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Ground Turkey and Broccoli Stir-fry
recipes.description: A quick and healthy stir-fry perfect for a weeknight, easily adaptable for kids.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon sesame oil or avocado oil
1 medium head of broccoli, cut into small florets
1/4 cup soy sauce or coconut aminos
Optional: Pinch of red pepper flakes (for adults)
Optional garnish: Sesame seeds, sliced green onions
instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add ground turkey and cook, breaking it apart, until browned. Drain any excess fat if necessary.
Add broccoli florets to the skillet. Stir-fry for 3-5 minutes until broccoli is tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce/coconut aminos, rice vinegar, grated ginger, and minced garlic. Add red pepper flakes if desired.
Pour the sauce over the turkey and broccoli mixture. Stir well to coat everything and cook for another 1-2 minutes until the sauce has slightly thickened and everything is heated through.
Serve hot, garnished with sesame seeds or green onions if desired. Serve over cauliflower rice for a complete meal.
recipes.notes: Recipe 112 - Ground Turkey and Broccoli Stir-fry - Main Course

recipes.name: Baked Chicken Drumsticks with Simple Seasoning
recipes.description: Easy and kid-friendly baked chicken drumsticks with a basic but flavorful seasoning.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil or melted butter
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or foil for easy cleanup.
Pat the chicken drumsticks dry with paper towels. This helps the skin get crispier.
In a small bowl, mix together paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, thyme/oregano, salt, and pepper.
Place the drumsticks in a large bowl or a large resealable plastic bag. Drizzle with olive oil or melted butter and toss to coat evenly.
Sprinkle the seasoning mixture over the drumsticks and toss again until all pieces are well coated.
Arrange the drumsticks in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet, ensuring they are not overcrowded.
Bake for 40-50 minutes, flipping halfway through, until the skin is golden brown and crispy, and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C) in the thickest part of the drumstick.
Let rest for a few minutes before serving. Kids love drumsticks!
recipes.notes: Recipe 113 - Baked Chicken Drumsticks with Simple Seasoning - Main Course

recipes.name: Cheesy Cauliflower Bake
recipes.description: A comforting and cheesy side dish or light main that kids often enjoy as a mac-and-cheese alternative.
ingredients: 1 large head of cauliflower, cut into small florets
1 cup shredded cheddar cheese (or a mix of cheddar and mozzarella)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: Pinch of nutmeg or garlic powder
Optional topping: Crushed pork rinds or extra cheese for a crispy top
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Steam or boil the cauliflower florets until tender-crisp (about 5-7 minutes). Drain very well to prevent a watery bake. Pat dry if necessary.
In a saucepan over medium-low heat, combine heavy cream, butter, and cubed cream cheese. Stir until melted and smooth.
Remove from heat. Stir in about 3/4 cup of the shredded cheddar cheese, salt, pepper, and nutmeg/garlic powder (if using) until the cheese is melted and the sauce is creamy.
Add the cooked cauliflower florets to the cheese sauce and toss gently to coat.
Transfer the cauliflower mixture to a greased baking dish (approx. 8x8 inch or similar).
Sprinkle the remaining 1/4 cup of shredded cheddar cheese (and pork rinds, if using) over the top.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until bubbly and the top is golden brown.
Let cool slightly before serving.
recipes.notes: Recipe 114 - Cheesy Cauliflower Bake - Main Course

recipes.name: Tuna Melt Chaffles
recipes.description: A quick and satisfying lunch or light dinner using chaffles as the 'bread'.
ingredients: 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella or cheddar cheese
1 (5 oz) can tuna in water or oil, drained well
1 teaspoon dill pickle relish or finely chopped pickle (optional)
2 slices cheddar or provolone cheese (for melting)
instructions: Preheat your mini waffle maker (chaffle maker).

Prepare Chaffles: In a small bowl, beat the egg. Stir in shredded cheese and almond flour (if using). Mix well. Cook two chaffles according to your maker's instructions (usually 3-5 minutes each) until golden and crisp. Set aside.
Prepare Tuna Salad: In another small bowl, combine drained tuna, mayonnaise, chopped celery (if using), and pickle relish/pickle (if using). Season with salt and pepper. Mix well.
Assemble Tuna Melts: Place one chaffle on a baking sheet or microwave-safe plate. Top with half of the tuna salad mixture, then a slice of cheese.
Repeat with the second chaffle, remaining tuna salad, and cheese slice.
Melt the cheese: You can do this under a broiler for 1-2 minutes (watch carefully!), in a toaster oven, or briefly in the microwave until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve immediately. Kids often enjoy these if they like tuna.
recipes.notes: Recipe 115 - Tuna Melt Chaffles - Main Course

recipes.name: Mint Chocolate Chip Fat Bombs
recipes.description: Refreshing mint and chocolate make these fat bombs an irresistible treat.
ingredients: Optional: 1-2 drops green food coloring (natural, if desired)
1/4 cup sugar-free chocolate chips (e.g., Lily's), finely chopped or mini
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine softened coconut oil, softened butter, powdered sweetener, and peppermint extract. Beat with an electric mixer or stir vigorously until smooth and fluffy.
If using, add a drop or two of green food coloring and mix until desired color is achieved.
Gently stir in the finely chopped or mini sugar-free chocolate chips.
Taste and adjust sweetener or peppermint extract if needed.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto a parchment-lined plate or use mini muffin liners/silicone molds.
Freeze for at least 30-60 minutes, or until firm.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer. These are a fantastic sweet fat bomb!
recipes.notes: Recipe 116 - Mint Chocolate Chip Fat Bombs - Desserts

recipes.name: Simple Berry Compote (Sugar-Free)
recipes.description: A quick and versatile berry compote to serve over keto pancakes, waffles, or yogurt.
ingredients: 1 cup mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries - fresh or frozen)
1-2 tablespoons keto-friendly granulated sweetener (e.g., erythritol), or to taste
instructions: Combine mixed berries, sweetener, and water in a small saucepan.
Heat over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally.
Cook for 5-10 minutes, until the berries begin to break down and the sauce thickens slightly. If using frozen berries, it may take a few minutes longer.
If you prefer a smoother compote, you can gently mash some of the berries with the back of a spoon during cooking.
Stir in lemon juice (if using) during the last minute of cooking.
Remove from heat and let cool. The compote will thicken more as it cools.
Serve warm or chilled. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week. Kids love this on keto treats.
recipes.notes: Recipe 117 - Simple Berry Compote (Sugar-Free) - Desserts

recipes.name: Chocolate Avocado Ice Cream (No-Churn)
recipes.description: Creamy, dairy-free (optional) chocolate ice cream made with avocado. Surprisingly delicious!
ingredients: 1 (13.5 oz) can full-fat coconut milk, chilled (use only the thick solid cream part, discard water, or use 1 cup heavy cream)
1/2 cup keto-friendly powdered sweetener (e.g., erythritol, or to taste)
Optional: 2 tablespoons almond butter for extra richness
instructions: Ensure the can of coconut milk has been chilled for at least 8 hours or overnight so the cream separates from the water. Scoop out only the thick solid cream (you should get about 1 cup). If using heavy cream, no separation needed.
In a food processor or high-speed blender, combine avocado flesh, coconut cream (or heavy cream), cocoa powder, powdered sweetener, vanilla extract, salt, and almond butter (if using).
Blend until completely smooth and creamy. Scrape down the sides as needed. Taste and adjust sweetener if necessary.
Transfer the mixture to a freezer-safe container (like a loaf pan). Cover tightly.
Freeze for at least 4-6 hours, or until firm. For a scoopable-er texture, you can stir it every hour for the first 2-3 hours of freezing to break up ice crystals.
Let sit at room temperature for 5-10 minutes before scooping and serving. Kids might be surprised this is made with avocado!
recipes.notes: Recipe 118 - Chocolate Avocado Ice Cream (No-Churn) - Desserts

recipes.name: Jello Fluff (Sugar-Free)
recipes.description: A light, airy, and jiggly dessert that's fun for kids and easy to make.
ingredients: 1 (0.3 oz or similar small box) sugar-free gelatin dessert mix (any flavor like strawberry, raspberry, lemon)
1 cup heavy whipping cream, chilled (or 8oz container of sugar-free whipped topping, thawed)
Optional: Fresh berries matching the Jello flavor for garnish
instructions: In a medium heatproof bowl, dissolve the sugar-free gelatin dessert mix completely in 1 cup of boiling water. Stir for at least 2 minutes until fully dissolved.
Stir in 1/2 cup of cold water.
Chill in the refrigerator for about 1 to 1.5 hours, or until the gelatin is partially set (like thick egg whites, but not fully firm). It should be jiggly but not liquid.

While the gelatin is chilling (or once it's partially set), whip the heavy cream in a separate chilled bowl with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form. (If using pre-made whipped topping, skip this step).
Once the gelatin is at the right consistency, gently fold the whipped cream (or thawed whipped topping) into the partially set gelatin until well combined and fluffy. Be careful not to overmix.
Spoon the Jello fluff into individual serving dishes or a single larger dish.
Refrigerate for at least another 1-2 hours, or until completely set and chilled.
Garnish with fresh berries if desired before serving. This is a nostalgic treat for many!
recipes.notes: Recipe 119 - Jello Fluff (Sugar-Free) - Desserts

recipes.name: Strawberry Milk (Sugar-Free)
recipes.description: A kid-friendly, creamy strawberry milk without the added sugar.
ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk (or other keto-friendly milk)
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., liquid stevia, erythritol)
instructions: Combine almond/coconut milk, strawberries, sweetener, and vanilla extract (if using) in a blender.
Blend until smooth and the strawberries are fully incorporated. If using frozen strawberries, it will be thicker and colder.
Taste and adjust sweetener if needed.
Pour into a glass and serve immediately. For a smoother milk, you can strain it through a fine-mesh sieve to remove any strawberry seeds, but this is optional.
recipes.notes: Recipe 120 - Strawberry Milk (Sugar-Free) - Drinks

recipes.name: Chocolate Milk (Sugar-Free)
recipes.description: Classic chocolate milk made keto-friendly and delicious.
ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk (or other keto-friendly milk)
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., liquid stevia, erythritol, or monk fruit)
instructions: In a glass or shaker cup, combine almond/coconut milk, cocoa powder, sweetener, vanilla extract, and salt.
Whisk vigorously or shake well until the cocoa powder is fully dissolved and the mixture is smooth. Using a small milk frother also works well.
Taste and adjust sweetener or cocoa powder if needed.
Serve chilled or over ice. A definite kid-pleaser!
recipes.notes: Recipe 121 - Chocolate Milk (Sugar-Free) - Drinks

recipes.name: Lemonade (Sugar-Free)
recipes.description: Refreshing homemade lemonade without the sugar, perfect for a summer day.
ingredients: 1 cup fresh lemon juice (from about 4-6 lemons)
4 cups cold water (still or sparkling for fizzy lemonade)
1/2 to 3/4 cup keto-friendly granulated sweetener (e.g., erythritol or allulose), or liquid sweetener to taste
Lemon slices and mint sprigs for garnish (optional)
instructions: If using granulated sweetener, it's best to make a simple syrup first: In a small saucepan, combine the sweetener with 1/2 cup of the water. Heat over medium-low heat, stirring, until the sweetener is completely dissolved. Let cool.
In a large pitcher, combine fresh lemon juice, the remaining 3.5 cups of cold water (or all 4 cups if using liquid sweetener), and the cooled simple syrup (or liquid sweetener to taste).
Stir well to combine.
Taste and adjust sweetener or lemon juice if needed. Some prefer it tarter, others sweeter.
Serve over ice, garnished with lemon slices and mint sprigs if desired. Always a family favorite.
recipes.notes: Recipe 122 - Lemonade (Sugar-Free) - Drinks

recipes.name: Raspberry Lime Rickey (Sugar-Free)
recipes.description: A fizzy and refreshing classic drink made keto-friendly.
ingredients: Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., liquid stevia or erythritol simple syrup)
1 cup sparkling water or club soda, chilled
Lime wedges and fresh raspberries for garnish (optional)
instructions: In a sturdy glass, gently muddle the fresh or frozen raspberries with the lime juice and sweetener. If using frozen raspberries, they will break down easily.
Fill the glass with ice cubes.
Top with chilled sparkling water or club soda.
Stir gently to combine.
Taste and adjust sweetener or lime juice if needed.
Garnish with lime wedges and a few fresh raspberries if desired. Serve immediately.
recipes.notes: Recipe 123 - Raspberry Lime Rickey (Sugar-Free) - Drinks

recipes.name: Coconut Lime Cooler Fat Bomb Drink
recipes.description: A creamy, zesty, and fat-packed drink that's both refreshing and satisfying.
ingredients: 1/2 cup full-fat coconut milk (canned, well shaken)
1/2 cup water or unsweetened almond milk
1 tablespoon MCT oil or coconut oil
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., liquid stevia or powdered erythritol)
instructions: Combine full-fat coconut milk, water/almond milk, lime juice, MCT oil/coconut oil, and sweetener in a blender.
Add ice cubes.
Blend until smooth, creamy, and frothy.
Taste and adjust sweetener or lime juice if needed.
Pour into a glass and garnish with a pinch of lime zest if desired.
Serve immediately. This is a great way to get healthy fats in a delicious drink.
recipes.notes: Recipe 124 - Coconut Lime Cooler Fat Bomb Drink - Drinks

recipes.name: Ham and Cheese Celery Boats
recipes.description: A crunchy and savory snack, fun for kids to assemble.
ingredients: 4-5 celery stalks, washed and cut into 3-4 inch pieces
Optional: A pinch of black pepper
instructions: In a small bowl, mix softened cream cheese, diced ham, and shredded cheddar cheese. Add pepper if desired.
Fill the groove of each celery stick with the ham and cheese mixture.
Serve immediately. These are a great quick snack and easy for kids to eat.
recipes.notes: Recipe 125 - Ham and Cheese Celery Boats - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Broccoli Cheese Bites
recipes.description: Cheesy baked bites packed with broccoli, a great way to get kids to eat veggies.
ingredients: 2 cups finely chopped broccoli florets (steamed or microwaved until tender-crisp, then cooled)
1/4 cup almond flour or crushed pork rinds
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease a mini muffin tin or line with mini paper liners.
Ensure steamed/microwaved broccoli is finely chopped and any excess moisture is squeezed out or patted dry.
In a medium bowl, combine chopped broccoli, cheddar cheese, Parmesan cheese, beaten egg, almond flour/pork rinds, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Spoon the mixture evenly into the prepared mini muffin cups, pressing down slightly.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown and set.
Let cool in the muffin tin for a few minutes before carefully removing. Serve warm with a keto-friendly dip if desired.
recipes.notes: Recipe 126 - Broccoli Cheese Bites - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Chocolate Coconut Fat Bombs
recipes.description: Rich chocolate and coconut combine in these satisfying fat bombs.
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine softened coconut oil, cocoa powder, shredded coconut, powdered sweetener, vanilla extract, and salt.
Mix well with a fork or electric mixer until smooth and fully combined.
Taste and adjust sweetener if needed.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto a parchment-lined plate or use mini muffin liners/silicone molds.
Freeze for at least 30 minutes, or until firm.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer. A simple and delicious fat bomb.
recipes.notes: Recipe 127 - Chocolate Coconut Fat Bombs - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: BLT Stuffed Avocado
recipes.description: A fresh and satisfying way to enjoy BLT flavors, with avocado as the base.
ingredients: 4 slices bacon, cooked crispy and crumbled
1/4 cup shredded lettuce (optional, for garnish or mixing in)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Squeeze of lime or lemon juice (to prevent avocado browning)
instructions: Scoop out a little bit of avocado flesh from the center of each avocado half to make a larger well, if needed. Mash the scooped-out flesh.
Brush the cut surfaces of the avocado halves with lime or lemon juice.
In a small bowl, combine crumbled bacon, diced tomatoes, and the mashed avocado flesh (if any). Add mayonnaise if desired and mix.
Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
Spoon the BLT mixture into the avocado halves.
Garnish with shredded lettuce if desired.
Serve immediately. A fun and interactive snack or light meal.
recipes.notes: Recipe 128 - BLT Stuffed Avocado - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Sausage and Cheese Egg Muffins
recipes.description: Easy, make-ahead breakfast muffins packed with sausage, cheese, and eggs.
ingredients: 1/2 lb ground breakfast sausage (check for no added sugar), cooked and crumbled
1/4 cup heavy cream or unsweetened almond milk
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: 1/4 cup finely chopped bell peppers or spinach
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease a 12-cup standard muffin tin.
In a large bowl, whisk the eggs. Stir in heavy cream/almond milk, salt, and pepper.
Add the cooked and crumbled sausage, shredded cheddar cheese, and optional chopped vegetables to the egg mixture. Stir to combine.
Divide the mixture evenly among the prepared muffin cups.
Bake for 18-22 minutes, or until the egg muffins are set and lightly golden on top.
Let cool in the muffin tin for a few minutes before carefully removing. Serve warm or store in the refrigerator for a quick breakfast. Very kid-friendly!
recipes.notes: Recipe 129 - Sausage and Cheese Egg Muffins - Breakfast

recipes.name: Almond Butter Smoothie
recipes.description: A creamy and filling smoothie with almond butter, perfect for a quick breakfast.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon chia seeds or flaxseed meal
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., liquid stevia or erythritol)
Optional: 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon or a scoop of keto protein powder
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender: almond milk, almond butter, chia seeds/flaxseed, sweetener, vanilla extract, ice cubes, and optional cinnamon/protein powder.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Taste and adjust sweetener if needed.
Pour into a glass and serve immediately. A simple and satisfying start to the day.
recipes.notes: Recipe 130 - Almond Butter Smoothie - Breakfast

recipes.name: Scrambled Eggs with Smoked Salmon and Chives
recipes.description: An elegant yet simple scramble, great for a special weekend breakfast.
ingredients: 2 oz smoked salmon, chopped or torn into small pieces
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: 1 tablespoon cream cheese or heavy cream for extra creamy eggs
instructions: In a bowl, whisk the eggs. If using, whisk in cream cheese or heavy cream. Season lightly with salt and pepper (smoked salmon is already salty).
Melt butter in a non-stick skillet over medium-low heat.
Pour in the egg mixture. Cook slowly, stirring gently and frequently with a spatula, until eggs are softly set but still moist.
Remove from heat. Gently fold in the chopped smoked salmon and fresh chives.
Serve immediately. Kids who like salmon will enjoy this.
recipes.notes: Recipe 131 - Scrambled Eggs with Smoked Salmon and Chives - Breakfast

recipes.name: Overnight No-Oats (Chia & Hemp Seed Porridge)
recipes.description: A make-ahead, creamy, and fiber-rich alternative to oatmeal.
ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., erythritol, stevia)
Optional toppings: Berries, chopped nuts, unsweetened shredded coconut, cinnamon
instructions: In a jar or container with a lid, combine chia seeds, hemp hearts, flaxseed meal (if using), almond/coconut milk, sweetener, and vanilla extract.
Stir or shake very well to combine, ensuring no clumps remain.
Cover and refrigerate overnight, or for at least 4-6 hours, until thickened to a porridge-like consistency.
In the morning, stir well. If it's too thick, add a little more milk to reach desired consistency.
Serve chilled, topped with your favorite keto-friendly toppings. Easy for busy mornings.
recipes.notes: Recipe 132 - Overnight No-Oats (Chia & Hemp Seed Porridge) - Breakfast

recipes.name: Greek Salad with Lemon-Herb Dressing
recipes.description: A classic, refreshing Greek salad bursting with flavor.
ingredients: 1/2 cup Kalamata olives, pitted and halved
4 oz feta cheese, crumbled or cubed
Optional: 1/2 green bell pepper, chopped (use sparingly)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Prepare the Lemon-Herb Dressing: In a small bowl or jar, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
In a large salad bowl, combine chopped romaine lettuce, diced cucumber, sliced red onion, Kalamata olives, and feta cheese. Add bell pepper if using.
Pour the dressing over the salad ingredients.
Toss gently to ensure everything is evenly coated.
Serve immediately. A simple and delicious salad that pairs well with many main dishes.
recipes.notes: Recipe 133 - Greek Salad with Lemon-Herb Dressing - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Creamy Coleslaw (Sugar-Free)
recipes.description: A classic creamy coleslaw made keto-friendly, perfect for BBQs and picnics.
ingredients: 1 (14-16 oz) bag coleslaw mix (shredded cabbage and carrots - use carrots sparingly for strict keto, or use all cabbage)
1-2 tablespoons keto-friendly sweetener (e.g., erythritol, or to taste)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large bowl, place the coleslaw mix.
In a small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, apple cider vinegar, sweetener, and celery seeds (if using).
Pour the dressing over the coleslaw mix. Toss well to combine thoroughly.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving to allow the flavors to meld and the cabbage to soften slightly. Kids often like the creaminess of this slaw.
recipes.notes: Recipe 134 - Creamy Coleslaw (Sugar-Free) - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Big Mac Salad (Layered or Tossed)
recipes.description: All the flavors of a Big Mac in a much healthier salad form. Super kid-friendly!
ingredients: 1 lb ground beef, cooked, crumbled, and cooled
1/4 cup finely chopped white or red onion
1 tablespoon dill pickle relish (or more chopped pickles)
Pinch of onion powder & garlic powder
instructions: Prepare the Special Sauce: In a small bowl, whisk together all sauce ingredients until well combined. Set aside or chill.
Assemble the Salad: In a large bowl (or individual bowls/jars for layering), start with a base of shredded iceberg lettuce.
Top with cooked ground beef, chopped pickles, chopped onion, and shredded cheddar cheese.
Drizzle generously with the Special Sauce.
If desired, you can toss everything together or serve it layered. For picky eaters, serving elements separately can work well too.
recipes.notes: Recipe 135 - Big Mac Salad (Layered or Tossed) - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Avocado Chicken Salad
recipes.description: A creamy and healthy chicken salad using avocado for creaminess instead of all mayo.
ingredients: 2 cups cooked and shredded or diced chicken
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: Chopped fresh cilantro or parsley
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine shredded/diced chicken, mashed avocado, chopped celery, and red onion (if using).
Add mayonnaise (if using) and lemon juice. Stir gently to combine all ingredients.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in fresh cilantro or parsley if desired.
Serve immediately in lettuce cups, on keto bread/crackers, or as is. A simple and nutritious option.
recipes.notes: Recipe 136 - Avocado Chicken Salad - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Cheesy Ground Beef and Cauliflower Rice Casserole
recipes.description: A hearty and comforting casserole that's easy to make and kid-approved.
ingredients: 1 (12-16 oz) bag frozen cauliflower rice, thawed and excess moisture squeezed out
1/2 cup beef broth or heavy cream
1 cup shredded cheddar cheese (or a mix of your favorite cheeses), divided
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).

In a large oven-safe skillet (or a regular skillet, then transfer to a baking dish), cook ground beef and chopped onion over medium heat until beef is browned and onion is softened. Drain any excess fat.
Stir in the thawed and squeezed cauliflower rice, cubed cream cheese, beef broth/heavy cream, 1/2 cup of the shredded cheddar cheese, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Cook, stirring, until the cream cheese is melted and the mixture is well combined and creamy.
If not using an oven-safe skillet, transfer the mixture to a greased baking dish (approx. 8x8 or 9x9 inch).
Sprinkle the remaining 1/2 cup of shredded cheddar cheese over the top.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until bubbly and the cheese on top is melted and golden.
Let cool slightly before serving. This is a great weeknight meal.
recipes.notes: Recipe 137 - Cheesy Ground Beef and Cauliflower Rice Casserole - Main Course

recipes.name: Salmon Patties (Canned Salmon)
recipes.description: Quick and budget-friendly salmon patties, great for a simple weeknight dinner.
ingredients: 2 (5-6 oz) cans pink or red salmon, drained and flaked (bones and skin removed if preferred)
1/4 cup almond flour or crushed pork rinds
2 tablespoons finely chopped onion or green onion
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
1-2 tablespoons olive oil or butter for frying
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine drained and flaked salmon, beaten egg, almond flour/pork rinds, chopped onion/green onion, mayonnaise/mustard, dill (if using), salt, and pepper. Mix gently until just combined (do not overmix).
Shape the mixture into 4-6 patties, about 1/2-inch thick.
Heat olive oil or butter in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Carefully place the salmon patties in the hot skillet. Cook for 4-6 minutes per side, until golden brown, heated through, and slightly crispy on the outside.
Serve warm with a side of keto tartar sauce or a squeeze of lemon. Kids often enjoy these.
recipes.notes: Recipe 138 - Salmon Patties (Canned Salmon) - Main Course

recipes.name: Lazy Cabbage Rolls (Unstuffed Cabbage Skillet)
recipes.description: All the flavor of cabbage rolls without the rolling! A quick one-pan meal.
ingredients: 1 lb ground beef or pork (or a mix)
1 small head of cabbage, cored and roughly chopped or shredded
1 (14.5 oz) can diced tomatoes, undrained (check for no sugar added)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: 1-2 tablespoons tomato paste for richer flavor
instructions: In a large deep skillet or Dutch oven, brown the ground meat and chopped onion over medium heat until meat is cooked through. Drain any excess fat.
Stir in minced garlic and cook for 1 minute more until fragrant.
Add the chopped/shredded cabbage to the skillet. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5-7 minutes, until the cabbage begins to wilt.
Stir in diced tomatoes (with their juice), beef broth, paprika, and tomato paste (if using). Season with salt and pepper.
Bring the mixture to a simmer. Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 15-20 minutes, or until the cabbage is tender and the flavors have melded. Stir occasionally.
Taste and adjust seasonings if needed.
Serve hot. Can be topped with a dollop of sour cream.
recipes.notes: Recipe 139 - Lazy Cabbage Rolls (Unstuffed Cabbage Skillet) - Main Course

recipes.name: Simple Pan-Seared Pork Chops
recipes.description: Quick and easy pork chops with a simple seasoning, perfect for a weeknight.
ingredients: 4 boneless or bone-in pork chops (about 3/4 to 1-inch thick)
1 tablespoon olive oil or avocado oil
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Pat the pork chops dry with paper towels. This helps them get a nice sear.
In a small bowl, combine garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. Sprinkle the seasoning mixture evenly over all sides of the pork chops, pressing it in gently.
Heat olive oil or avocado oil in a large skillet (cast iron works well) over medium-high heat.
Carefully place the seasoned pork chops in the hot skillet. Do not overcrowd; cook in batches if necessary.
Sear for 3-5 minutes per side, until golden brown and an internal thermometer inserted into the thickest part reads 145°F (63°C). Cooking time will vary based on thickness.
Remove from skillet and let the pork chops rest for 3-5 minutes before serving. This helps keep them juicy. Serve with your favorite keto sides.
recipes.notes: Recipe 140 - Simple Pan-Seared Pork Chops - Main Course

recipes.name: No-Bake Peanut Butter Energy Bites
recipes.description: Quick and easy energy bites packed with peanut butter and healthy fats.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons chia seeds or flaxseed meal
Optional: 1/4 cup sugar-free chocolate chips, mini or chopped
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine peanut butter, almond flour, powdered sweetener, shredded coconut (if using), chia seeds/flaxseed, and vanilla extract.
Mix well until a thick, uniform 'dough' forms. If it's too sticky, you can add a little more almond flour. If too dry, a tiny bit more peanut butter.
If using, stir in the sugar-free chocolate chips.
Roll the mixture into small balls (about 1 inch in diameter).
Place on a parchment-lined plate.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 20-30 minutes to firm up, or freeze for a quicker set.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator. These are great for a quick snack or dessert.
recipes.notes: Recipe 141 - No-Bake Peanut Butter Energy Bites - Desserts

recipes.name: Whipped Cream with Berries
recipes.description: A classic, simple, and light keto dessert.
ingredients: 1-2 tablespoons keto-friendly powdered sweetener (e.g., erythritol, or to taste)
instructions: Ensure the heavy whipping cream and the mixing bowl (and beaters, if possible) are well chilled. This helps the cream whip up better.
In the chilled mixing bowl, combine heavy whipping cream, powdered sweetener, and vanilla extract.
Beat with an electric mixer on medium-high speed until soft or stiff peaks form, according to your preference (usually 2-4 minutes). Be careful not to overbeat, or it will turn into butter.
Gently fold in or serve topped with fresh mixed berries.
Serve immediately. A universally loved simple dessert.
recipes.notes: Recipe 142 - Whipped Cream with Berries - Desserts

recipes.name: Sugar-Free Gummy Bears (Gelatin)
recipes.description: Homemade gummy bears using sugar-free Jello or fruit extracts.
ingredients: 1/2 cup water (or fruit juice like unsweetened cranberry or lemon, if fitting macros)
1 small box (0.3 oz) sugar-free Jello (any flavor) OR 1/2 tsp fruit extract + keto sweetener to taste
Optional: Keto-friendly liquid sweetener if not using Jello or if extra sweetness is desired
instructions: Lightly grease gummy bear molds with a tiny bit of coconut oil if they tend to stick, or ensure they are clean and dry.
In a small saucepan, pour the 1/2 cup of water (or juice). Sprinkle the unflavored gelatin powder over the liquid and let it sit for 5 minutes to bloom (it will absorb the liquid and look wrinkly).
Once bloomed, heat the saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly, until the gelatin is completely dissolved. Do not boil.
Remove from heat. If using sugar-free Jello, whisk it in now until completely dissolved. If using fruit extract and sweetener, add them now and stir well.
Taste the mixture (carefully, it might be warm) and adjust sweetener if needed.
Carefully pour or use a dropper to fill the gummy bear molds with the liquid mixture.
Refrigerate for at least 20-30 minutes, or until the gummies are firm.
Once firm, carefully pop the gummies out of the molds.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Kids love making and eating these!
recipes.notes: Recipe 143 - Sugar-Free Gummy Bears (Gelatin) - Desserts

recipes.name: Mocha Fat Bombs
recipes.description: A delicious combination of coffee and chocolate in a rich fat bomb.
ingredients: 1-2 teaspoons instant coffee powder or espresso powder (adjust to taste)
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine softened coconut oil, softened butter, cocoa powder, instant coffee/espresso powder, powdered sweetener, and vanilla extract.
Beat with an electric mixer or stir vigorously until all ingredients are well combined and the mixture is smooth and fluffy.
Taste and adjust sweetener or coffee powder if needed.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto a parchment-lined plate or use mini muffin liners/silicone molds.
Freeze for at least 30-60 minutes, or until firm.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer. Perfect for a coffee lover's treat.
recipes.notes: Recipe 144 - Mocha Fat Bombs - Desserts

recipes.name: Simple Iced Coffee
recipes.description: A basic and refreshing iced coffee, easily customized.
ingredients: 1 cup chilled brewed coffee (strong brew recommended, or cold brew concentrate diluted)
1/4 cup unsweetened almond milk or heavy cream (or a mix)
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., liquid stevia, erythritol syrup)
Optional: 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract or sugar-free syrup (vanilla, caramel)
instructions: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Pour in the chilled brewed coffee.
Add unsweetened almond milk or heavy cream.
Add sweetener to taste and vanilla extract or sugar-free syrup if using.
Stir well to combine.
Adjust ingredients to your preference. A simple way for older kids and adults to enjoy a cool drink.
recipes.notes: Recipe 145 - Simple Iced Coffee - Drinks

recipes.name: Herbal Iced Tea (Unsweetened)
recipes.description: A refreshing and caffeine-free iced tea using your favorite herbal tea bags.
ingredients: 4-6 herbal tea bags (e.g., hibiscus, chamomile, peppermint, berry blend - check for no added sugars)
Optional: Lemon slices, mint sprigs, or fresh berries for garnish
instructions: Place herbal tea bags in a large heatproof pitcher.
Pour boiling water over the tea bags. Let steep for 5-10 minutes (or according to tea instructions – some herbal teas can steep longer).
Remove tea bags.
If using sweetener, stir it in now while the tea concentrate is hot to help it dissolve.
Add cold water to the pitcher. Stir well.
Refrigerate until thoroughly chilled, or serve immediately over ice.
Garnish with lemon, mint, or berries if desired. Many herbal teas are naturally appealing to kids.
recipes.notes: Recipe 146 - Herbal Iced Tea (Unsweetened) - Drinks

recipes.name: Salted Caramel Flavored Coffee (Sugar-Free)
recipes.description: Indulgent tasting coffee with salted caramel notes, without the sugar.
ingredients: 1-2 tablespoons heavy cream or unsweetened almond milk
1/2 - 1 teaspoon sugar-free salted caramel syrup (e.g., Torani, Jordan's Skinny Syrups)
Optional: Pinch of extra sea salt
Optional: Keto-friendly whipped cream for topping
instructions: Pour hot coffee into a mug.
Stir in heavy cream or almond milk.
Add sugar-free salted caramel syrup to taste. Start with a smaller amount and add more if needed.
If desired, add an extra tiny pinch of sea salt to enhance the salted caramel flavor.
Stir well.
Top with keto-friendly whipped cream if desired. A nice treat for adults or older kids.
recipes.notes: Recipe 147 - Salted Caramel Flavored Coffee (Sugar-Free) - Drinks

recipes.name: Watermelon Agua Fresca (Low Carb)
recipes.description: A lightly sweet and refreshing drink, use watermelon in moderation for keto.
ingredients: 2 cups cubed seedless watermelon (about 1/4 of a small watermelon)
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (optional, watermelon is naturally sweet)
instructions: Combine cubed watermelon and 1 cup of the cold water in a blender.
Blend until completely smooth.
Strain the watermelon mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a pitcher, pressing gently on the solids to extract as much liquid as possible. Discard the pulp.
Add the remaining 2 cups of cold water and lime juice (if using) to the pitcher. Stir well.
Taste and add keto-friendly sweetener if desired, though watermelon often provides enough natural sweetness for a light drink.
Serve chilled over ice, garnished with mint sprigs if desired. Remember to enjoy watermelon in moderation on a keto diet due to its natural sugar content, but a small amount can be refreshing.
recipes.notes: Recipe 148 - Watermelon Agua Fresca (Low Carb) - Drinks

recipes.name: Vanilla Steamer (Sugar-Free)
recipes.description: A warm, comforting, and simple milk-based drink, like a caffeine-free latte.
ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk (or other keto milk)
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., liquid stevia, erythritol)
Optional: Pinch of cinnamon or nutmeg for topping
instructions: Heat the almond/coconut milk in a small saucepan over medium-low heat until warm (do not boil). Alternatively, heat in the microwave.
If you have a milk frother, froth the warm milk until foamy.
Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla extract and sweetener to taste.
Pour into a mug.
If not frothed, you can simply stir well. If frothed, spoon the foam on top.
Sprinkle with a pinch of cinnamon or nutmeg if desired.
A simple, warm, and comforting drink, great for kids before bedtime.
recipes.notes: Recipe 149 - Vanilla Steamer (Sugar-Free) - Drinks

recipes.name: Spicy Tuna Stuffed Avocado
recipes.description: A flavorful and satisfying snack or light meal with a bit of a kick.
ingredients: 1 (5 oz) can tuna in oil or water, drained well
1 teaspoon sriracha or keto-friendly hot sauce (or to taste)
1 tablespoon finely chopped green onion or cilantro
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Scoop out a small amount of flesh from the center of each avocado half to create a larger well; mash this extra avocado.
Brush the cut surfaces of the avocado with lime juice to prevent browning.
In a small bowl, combine drained tuna, mayonnaise, sriracha, chopped green onion/cilantro, and the mashed avocado. Mix well.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Spoon the spicy tuna mixture into the avocado halves.
Serve immediately. This is a quick and easy option with a more adult flavor profile.
recipes.notes: Recipe 150 - Spicy Tuna Stuffed Avocado - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Mediterranean Veggie Skewers with Feta Dip
recipes.description: Colorful and fresh vegetable skewers, perfect with a tangy feta dip. Great for a lighter family snack.
ingredients: 1 red bell pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 green bell pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 small zucchini, sliced into 1/2-inch thick rounds
2 tablespoons sour cream or full-fat Greek yogurt
Pinch of dried oregano or fresh dill
instructions: If using wooden skewers, soak them in water for 20-30 minutes to prevent burning (if grilling).
Thread the vegetable pieces onto the skewers in an alternating pattern.
You can grill the skewers for 5-7 minutes, turning occasionally, until slightly charred and tender-crisp, or serve them raw for a fresh crunch.
Prepare the Feta Dip: In a small food processor or bowl (if mashing by hand), combine feta cheese, sour cream/yogurt, olive oil, lemon juice, and oregano/dill. Blend or mash until relatively smooth.
Serve the vegetable skewers with the feta dip on the side. This is a refreshing and healthy family snack option.
recipes.notes: Recipe 151 - Mediterranean Veggie Skewers with Feta Dip - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Coffee Fat Bombs
recipes.description: A perfect pick-me-up fat bomb for coffee lovers.
ingredients: 1-2 teaspoons instant coffee or espresso powder
Optional: 1 tablespoon heavy cream for extra creaminess
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine softened coconut oil, softened butter, powdered sweetener, instant coffee/espresso powder, and vanilla extract.
If using, add heavy cream.
Beat with an electric mixer or stir vigorously until well combined, smooth, and fluffy.
Taste and adjust sweetener or coffee powder if needed.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto a parchment-lined plate or use mini muffin liners/silicone molds.
Freeze for at least 30-60 minutes, or until firm.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer.
recipes.notes: Recipe 152 - Coffee Fat Bombs - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Baked Buffalo Cauliflower Bites
recipes.description: Spicy and flavorful cauliflower bites, a great alternative to buffalo wings.
ingredients: 1 medium head of cauliflower, cut into bite-sized florets
2 tablespoons melted butter or avocado oil
1/4 cup keto-friendly buffalo hot sauce (e.g., Frank's RedHot Original)
Optional dip: Keto ranch or blue cheese dressing
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, toss the cauliflower florets with melted butter/avocado oil, garlic powder, and salt until evenly coated.
Spread the cauliflower in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.
Roast for 15-20 minutes, until tender-crisp and lightly browned.
While cauliflower is roasting, in a small bowl, whisk together the buffalo hot sauce (you can add a little more melted butter to the sauce if you like it richer).
Remove cauliflower from oven and pour it back into the large bowl (or use a new one). Drizzle with the buffalo sauce and toss gently to coat all pieces.
Spread the sauced cauliflower back onto the baking sheet.
Return to the oven and bake for another 5-10 minutes, until the sauce is slightly caramelized and the cauliflower is heated through.
Serve warm with keto ranch or blue cheese dressing for dipping. A good option for older teens who like some spice.
recipes.notes: Recipe 153 - Baked Buffalo Cauliflower Bites - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Crustless Quiche Lorraine
recipes.description: A classic quiche without the crust, packed with bacon, cheese, and eggs. Great for any meal.
ingredients: 6 slices bacon, cooked crispy and crumbled
1/2 cup chopped onion or shallot, sautéed until soft (optional)
1 cup shredded Gruyère or Swiss cheese
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease a 9-inch pie dish or similar baking dish.
Sprinkle the crumbled bacon, sautéed onion/shallot (if using), and shredded cheese evenly over the bottom of the prepared dish.
In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, heavy cream, salt, pepper, and nutmeg (if using) until well combined.
Pour the egg mixture evenly over the bacon and cheese in the dish.
Bake for 30-40 minutes, or until the quiche is set, the center is just slightly jiggly, and the top is golden brown.
Let cool for at least 10-15 minutes before slicing and serving. Can be served warm or at room temperature. Suitable for a family brunch or light dinner.
recipes.notes: Recipe 154 - Crustless Quiche Lorraine - Breakfast

recipes.name: Breakfast Sausage and Veggie Skillet
recipes.description: A hearty one-pan breakfast with sausage and your favorite low-carb veggies.
ingredients: 1 lb ground breakfast sausage (check for no sugar added) or sliced smoked sausage
1 tablespoon olive oil or avocado oil
Optional: Serve with fried or scrambled eggs on top
instructions: If using ground sausage, cook it in a large skillet over medium heat, breaking it apart, until browned. Drain excess fat. If using sliced smoked sausage, brown it lightly.
Add olive oil/avocado oil to the skillet if needed. Add bell peppers, onion, and mushrooms. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
If using spinach or kale, add it to the skillet during the last 2-3 minutes of cooking and stir until wilted.
Return the cooked sausage to the skillet if cooked separately. Stir everything together to combine and heat through.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve warm, on its own or topped with fried/scrambled eggs. A very adaptable weeknight-friendly breakfast-for-dinner option.
recipes.notes: Recipe 155 - Breakfast Sausage and Veggie Skillet - Breakfast

recipes.name: Ricotta and Berry Breakfast Bowl
recipes.description: A simple, creamy, and refreshing breakfast bowl.
ingredients: 1/4 cup mixed berries (fresh or frozen, thawed)
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., liquid stevia or powdered erythritol, optional)
Optional: Pinch of cinnamon or a drizzle of sugar-free vanilla syrup
instructions: Spoon ricotta cheese into a serving bowl.
Top with mixed berries and chopped nuts.
If desired, drizzle with sweetener or sprinkle with cinnamon/vanilla syrup.
Stir gently or enjoy as is. A quick and elegant breakfast.
recipes.notes: Recipe 156 - Ricotta and Berry Breakfast Bowl - Breakfast

recipes.name: Savory Chaffles with Ham and Cheese
recipes.description: A savory version of chaffles, perfect for a quick breakfast sandwich.
ingredients: 1/2 cup shredded cheddar or mozzarella cheese
Pinch of garlic powder or onion powder (optional)
2 slices cheese (e.g., Swiss, provolone, or more cheddar)
instructions: Preheat your mini waffle maker (chaffle maker).
Prepare Chaffles: In a small bowl, beat the egg. Stir in shredded cheese, almond flour (if using), and garlic/onion powder (if using). Mix well.
Cook two chaffles according to your maker's instructions (usually 3-5 minutes each) until golden and crisp.
Assemble Sandwich: Place a slice of ham and a slice of cheese between the two warm chaffles.
You can serve immediately, or briefly return the assembled chaffle sandwich to the waffle maker or a warm skillet for 30-60 seconds to melt the cheese inside.
A quick and satisfying hot breakfast.
recipes.notes: Recipe 157 - Savory Chaffles with Ham and Cheese - Breakfast

recipes.name: Gazpacho (Low Carb Version)
recipes.description: A refreshing chilled vegetable soup, perfect for hot weather. Adjust veggies for keto.
ingredients: 1 large cucumber, peeled, seeded, and roughly chopped
1 green bell pepper, cored, seeded, and roughly chopped
2-3 medium ripe tomatoes, roughly chopped (use sparingly for stricter keto, or use canned diced with no sugar added)
1/2 cup cold water (or more, to desired consistency)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional garnish: Diced cucumber, bell pepper, a drizzle of olive oil
instructions: Combine chopped cucumber, green bell pepper, tomatoes, red onion, and garlic in a blender or food processor.
Add olive oil, red wine vinegar, and 1/2 cup of cold water.
Blend until smooth, or leave slightly chunky if preferred. Add more cold water, a little at a time, to reach your desired consistency.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Transfer the gazpacho to a container and chill in the refrigerator for at least 1-2 hours (preferably longer) to allow flavors to meld and the soup to get very cold.
Serve chilled, garnished with a little extra diced cucumber, bell pepper, and a drizzle of olive oil if desired. A sophisticated yet easy soup.
recipes.notes: Recipe 158 - Gazpacho (Low Carb Version) - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Asian Slaw with Sesame Ginger Dressing
recipes.description: A crunchy and flavorful slaw with an Asian-inspired dressing.
ingredients: 1 (14-16 oz) bag coleslaw mix (shredded cabbage and carrots - can use mostly cabbage)
3 tablespoons avocado oil or light olive oil
1 tablespoon soy sauce or coconut aminos
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., a few drops of liquid stevia)
instructions: Prepare the Sesame Ginger Dressing: In a small bowl or jar, whisk together avocado/olive oil, rice vinegar, soy sauce/coconut aminos, sesame oil, grated ginger, minced garlic, and sweetener. Set aside.
In a large salad bowl, combine coleslaw mix, sliced red bell pepper, sliced green onions, and cilantro (if using).
Pour the dressing over the slaw ingredients. Toss well to ensure everything is evenly coated.
Stir in the sesame seeds.
Serve immediately for a crunchy texture, or let it sit for 15-20 minutes to allow flavors to meld slightly. A vibrant and tasty family side dish.
recipes.notes: Recipe 159 - Asian Slaw with Sesame Ginger Dressing - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Wedge Salad with Blue Cheese Dressing
recipes.description: A classic steakhouse salad that's simple to make at home.
ingredients: 1 head iceberg lettuce, cored and cut into 4 wedges
1/2 cup keto blue cheese dressing (store-bought or homemade)
4 slices bacon, cooked crispy and crumbled (optional)
1/4 cup cherry tomatoes, halved or quartered (optional)
2 tablespoons crumbled blue cheese (extra, for topping)
instructions: Place each iceberg lettuce wedge on an individual salad plate.
Drizzle generously with keto blue cheese dressing over each wedge.
Sprinkle with crumbled crispy bacon (if using), cherry tomatoes (if using), and extra crumbled blue cheese.
Season with freshly ground black pepper.
Serve immediately. A simple yet elegant salad.
recipes.notes: Recipe 160 - Wedge Salad with Blue Cheese Dressing - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Radish and Cucumber Salad with Dill
recipes.description: A crisp, peppery, and refreshing salad perfect for summer.
ingredients: 1/4 small red onion, very thinly sliced (optional)
1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar or white wine vinegar
1 tablespoon chopped fresh dill (or 1 tsp dried)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: In a medium salad bowl, combine sliced radishes, sliced cucumber, and thinly sliced red onion (if using).
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, vinegar, and dill.
Pour the dressing over the vegetables. Toss gently to coat.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
For best flavor, let the salad sit for 10-15 minutes at room temperature or chill briefly before serving.
recipes.notes: Recipe 161 - Radish and Cucumber Salad with Dill - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Lemon Garlic Butter Chicken Thighs
recipes.description: Juicy and flavorful chicken thighs cooked in a rich lemon garlic butter sauce. A weeknight winner.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon dried Italian seasoning or a mix of thyme and rosemary
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Pat chicken thighs dry and season generously with salt, pepper, and Italian seasoning.
Heat olive oil and 1 tablespoon of butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken thighs to the hot skillet (do not overcrowd, cook in batches if needed). Sear for 3-5 minutes per side, until golden brown.
Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
Reduce heat to medium. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter to the skillet. Add minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute until fragrant (be careful not to burn).
Pour in chicken broth and lemon juice, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan. Bring to a simmer.
Return the chicken thighs to the skillet. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and tender (internal temperature 165°F or 74°C).
Uncover and let the sauce thicken slightly if needed. Spoon sauce over chicken.
Garnish with fresh parsley and serve hot with a side of cauliflower rice or steamed green beans. Easy and very family-friendly.
recipes.notes: Recipe 162 - Lemon Garlic Butter Chicken Thighs - Main Course

recipes.name: Sausage, Pepper, and Onion Skillet
recipes.description: A classic and simple one-pan meal that's flavorful and satisfying.
