ingredients: 1-1.5 lbs smoked sausage (like Kielbasa or Italian sausage, check for low sugar), sliced into 1/2-inch rounds
1 tablespoon olive oil or avocado oil
1 large green bell pepper, cored, seeded, and sliced
1 large red bell pepper, cored, seeded, and sliced
1/2 teaspoon dried Italian seasoning or oregano
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Heat olive oil/avocado oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add sliced sausage to the skillet and cook for 3-5 minutes, until lightly browned. Remove sausage from skillet and set aside.
Add sliced onions and bell peppers to the same skillet (add a little more oil if needed). Cook, stirring occasionally, for 8-10 minutes, until vegetables are softened and slightly caramelized.
Add minced garlic (if using) and Italian seasoning/oregano during the last minute of cooking the vegetables.
Return the cooked sausage to the skillet with the vegetables. Stir to combine and heat through for another 2-3 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot. This can be served on its own, with cauliflower rice, or in lettuce wraps. A very easy weeknight meal.
recipes.notes: Recipe 163 - Sausage, Pepper, and Onion Skillet - Main Course

recipes.name: Creamy Pesto Chicken with Cherry Tomatoes
recipes.description: A quick and flavorful chicken dish with a creamy pesto sauce and sweet cherry tomatoes.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces
1/4 cup keto-friendly basil pesto (check labels for oils and sugar)
2 tablespoons cream cheese, softened (optional, for extra creaminess)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: Grated Parmesan cheese for topping
instructions: Season chicken pieces with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides and cooked through. Remove chicken and set aside.
Reduce heat to medium-low. In the same skillet, stir together basil pesto, heavy cream, and cream cheese (if using) until the cream cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth and heated through.
Stir in the halved cherry tomatoes and cook for 2-3 minutes, just until they begin to soften.
Return the cooked chicken to the skillet and toss to coat with the creamy pesto sauce. Heat through.
Serve hot, garnished with grated Parmesan cheese if desired. Great over zoodles or cauliflower rice. This is a sophisticated but easy weeknight option.
recipes.notes: Recipe 164 - Creamy Pesto Chicken with Cherry Tomatoes - Main Course

recipes.name: Baked Cod with Roasted Asparagus and Lemon
recipes.description: A healthy and simple one-sheet-pan meal, perfect for a light weeknight dinner.
ingredients: 4 cod fillets (or other white fish, about 4-6 oz each)
2 tablespoons olive oil or melted butter
1 lemon, half sliced thinly, half juiced
1 teaspoon garlic powder or 2 cloves minced garlic
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: Pinch of red pepper flakes or dried dill
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
Toss asparagus with 1 tablespoon of olive oil/melted butter, salt, and pepper directly on one side of the baking sheet. Spread in a single layer.
Pat the cod fillets dry. Place them on the other side of the baking sheet.
In a small bowl, combine the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil/melted butter, lemon juice, garlic powder/minced garlic, and optional red pepper flakes/dill. Season with salt and pepper.
Brush or pour this mixture evenly over the cod fillets. Top each fillet with a thin lemon slice.
Bake for 12-18 minutes, depending on the thickness of the cod and asparagus, until the fish is opaque and flakes easily with a fork, and the asparagus is tender-crisp.
Serve immediately. A very straightforward and healthy meal.
recipes.notes: Recipe 165 - Baked Cod with Roasted Asparagus and Lemon - Main Course

recipes.name: Vanilla Custard Fat Bombs
recipes.description: Creamy and smooth fat bombs with a classic vanilla custard flavor.
ingredients: Optional: 1-2 tablespoons heavy cream for extra richness
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine softened coconut oil, softened butter, powdered sweetener, and vanilla extract.
If using, add heavy cream and nutmeg.
Beat with an electric mixer or stir vigorously until well combined, smooth, and fluffy. The mixture should resemble a thick custard.
Taste and adjust sweetener or vanilla if needed.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto a parchment-lined plate or use mini muffin liners/silicone molds.
Freeze for at least 30-60 minutes, or until firm.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer.
recipes.notes: Recipe 166 - Vanilla Custard Fat Bombs - Desserts

recipes.name: Chocolate Bark with Nuts and Seeds (Sugar-Free)
recipes.description: A simple and customizable chocolate treat, perfect for satisfying cravings.
ingredients: 1 cup sugar-free chocolate chips (e.g., Lily's dark or milk chocolate)
1/4 cup mixed chopped nuts (almonds, walnuts, pecans)
2 tablespoons seeds (pumpkin seeds, sunflower seeds, chia seeds)
Optional: Unsweetened shredded coconut, pinch of sea salt
instructions: Line a small baking sheet or plate with parchment paper.

In a microwave-safe bowl or a double boiler, melt the sugar-free chocolate chips with the coconut oil. Microwave in 20-30 second intervals, stirring in between, until smooth. Be careful not to overheat.
Pour the melted chocolate onto the prepared parchment paper and spread it into a thin, even layer (about 1/4 inch thick).
Sprinkle the chopped nuts, seeds, shredded coconut (if using), and a pinch of sea salt (if using) evenly over the melted chocolate.
Gently press the toppings into the chocolate if needed.
Refrigerate for at least 30-60 minutes, or until the chocolate is completely firm.
Once firm, break the chocolate bark into irregular pieces.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator. A very easy and adaptable family treat.
recipes.notes: Recipe 167 - Chocolate Bark with Nuts and Seeds (Sugar-Free) - Desserts

recipes.name: Strawberry Cream Cheese Bites (No-Bake)
recipes.description: Quick, no-bake bites with a creamy strawberry cheesecake flavor.
ingredients: Optional coating: 1/4 cup almond flour or unsweetened shredded coconut
instructions: In a medium bowl, beat together softened cream cheese, softened butter, and powdered sweetener until smooth and fluffy.
Gently fold in the finely diced strawberries and vanilla extract.
Chill the mixture in the refrigerator for about 20-30 minutes to firm up slightly.
Roll the mixture into small balls (about 1 inch in diameter).
If desired, roll the bites in almond flour or shredded coconut to coat.
Place on a parchment-lined plate and refrigerate or freeze for at least 30 minutes, or until firm.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.
recipes.notes: Recipe 168 - Strawberry Cream Cheese Bites (No-Bake) - Desserts

recipes.name: Cinnamon Mug Cake
recipes.description: A warm and comforting single-serving cinnamon cake made in minutes.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon melted butter or coconut oil
1 tablespoon unsweetened almond milk or heavy cream
instructions: In a microwave-safe mug (at least 10-12 oz capacity), whisk together almond flour, coconut flour (if using), sweetener, cinnamon, baking powder, and salt.
Add the egg, melted butter/oil, almond milk/cream, and vanilla extract to the mug. Stir well with a fork until a smooth batter forms.
Microwave on high for 60-90 seconds. Cooking time may vary depending on microwave wattage. The cake should be cooked through and spring back when touched.
Let cool in the mug for a minute or two before eating, as it will be very hot.
Optional: Top with a dollop of keto whipped cream or a sprinkle of extra cinnamon.
recipes.notes: Recipe 169 - Cinnamon Mug Cake - Desserts

recipes.name: Arnold Palmer (Sugar-Free)
recipes.description: A refreshing mix of iced tea and lemonade, made keto-friendly.
ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened iced tea (black tea, chilled)
1 cup sugar-free lemonade (homemade or store-bought, check labels)
Optional: Lemon wedge or mint sprig for garnish
instructions: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Pour in the unsweetened iced tea until the glass is about half full.
Top off with sugar-free lemonade.
Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with a lemon wedge or mint sprig if desired.
Adjust the ratio of tea to lemonade to your preference. A classic thirst-quencher.
recipes.notes: Recipe 170 - Arnold Palmer (Sugar-Free) - Drinks

recipes.name: Spiced Cranberry Spritzer (Sugar-Free)
recipes.description: A festive and refreshing drink, good for holidays or any time of year.
ingredients: 1/2 cup unsweetened cranberry juice (100% juice, no sugar added - use sparingly)
1 cup sparkling water or club soda, chilled
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., liquid stevia or erythritol)
Pinch of ground cinnamon or a small piece of cinnamon stick
Optional: Squeeze of lime juice, fresh cranberries or orange slice for garnish
instructions: In a glass, combine unsweetened cranberry juice, sweetener, and cinnamon/cinnamon stick.
Add a squeeze of lime juice if desired.
Fill the glass with ice cubes.
Top with chilled sparkling water or club soda.
Stir gently.
Garnish with fresh cranberries or an orange slice if desired. Remember cranberry juice has natural sugars, so use a small amount and ensure it's unsweetened.
recipes.notes: Recipe 171 - Spiced Cranberry Spritzer (Sugar-Free) - Drinks

recipes.name: Italian Cream Soda (Sugar-Free)
recipes.description: A customizable and creamy soda fountain classic, made keto.
ingredients: 1 cup sparkling water or club soda, chilled
2-3 tablespoons sugar-free flavored syrup (e.g., raspberry, vanilla, strawberry - Torani or Jordan's Skinny Syrups work well)
Optional: Keto whipped cream for topping
instructions: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Pour in the sugar-free flavored syrup.
Add the sparkling water or club soda, leaving a little room at the top.
Gently pour the heavy cream on top. It will swirl down into the soda.
Stir gently if you want it fully mixed, or leave it layered for visual appeal.
Top with keto whipped cream if desired.
Serve immediately. A fun drink for the whole family to customize with different syrup flavors.
recipes.notes: Recipe 172 - Italian Cream Soda (Sugar-Free) - Drinks

recipes.name: Warm Lemon Water with Ginger
recipes.description: A simple, soothing, and potentially digestive-aiding warm drink.
ingredients: 1/4 - 1/2 inch fresh ginger, thinly sliced or grated
Optional: Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., a few drops of stevia)
instructions: Pour hot water into a mug.
Squeeze in the fresh lemon juice.
Add the sliced or grated fresh ginger.
Stir well.
Add sweetener if desired.
Let steep for a few minutes to allow the ginger to infuse.
Sip slowly while warm. A good morning or evening ritual.
recipes.notes: Recipe 173 - Warm Lemon Water with Ginger - Drinks

recipes.name: Mocha Latte (Sugar-Free)
recipes.description: A coffee shop favorite made at home, keto style.
ingredients: 1 cup freshly brewed hot coffee or 1-2 shots of espresso
1/2 cup unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk, heated and frothed (optional)
1-2 tablespoons keto-friendly sweetener (e.g., erythritol, or to taste)
Optional: Keto whipped cream and a sprinkle of cocoa powder for topping
instructions: In a mug, combine cocoa powder and sweetener. Add a tablespoon of the hot coffee or a little hot water and stir to make a smooth chocolate paste. This prevents cocoa clumps.
Pour in the rest of the hot coffee/espresso and stir well.
Stir in the vanilla extract.
If using, pour in the heated and frothed almond/coconut milk.
Top with keto whipped cream and a sprinkle of cocoa powder if desired.
Serve immediately. A comforting and indulgent-tasting drink.
recipes.notes: Recipe 174 - Mocha Latte (Sugar-Free) - Drinks

recipes.name: Garlic Herb Cheese Log
recipes.description: A simple yet elegant cheese log, perfect for serving with keto crackers or veggies.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon chopped fresh chives or green onion tops
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional coating: Chopped pecans, walnuts, or more fresh herbs
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine softened cream cheese, shredded cheddar, Parmesan cheese, minced garlic, parsley, chives, and dill (if using). Season with salt and pepper.
Mix with a fork or electric mixer until well combined and relatively smooth.
Lay out a piece of plastic wrap or parchment paper. Spoon the cheese mixture onto it and shape it into a log (about 6-8 inches long).
Wrap the log tightly in the plastic wrap/parchment paper.
Refrigerate for at least 1-2 hours to firm up.
Before serving, if desired, unwrap the log and roll it in chopped nuts or more fresh herbs to coat the outside.
Serve with keto-friendly crackers, celery sticks, cucumber slices, or bell pepper strips. A crowd-pleaser for family gatherings.
recipes.notes: Recipe 175 - Garlic Herb Cheese Log - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Smoked Salmon Pinwheels with Dill Cream Cheese
recipes.description: Elegant and easy no-cook pinwheels, great for appetizers or a light snack.
ingredients: Optional: Low-carb tortillas or large lettuce leaves as a base if not rolling salmon directly
instructions: In a small bowl, combine softened cream cheese, chopped dill, lemon juice, and black pepper. Mix well.
If using tortillas/lettuce: Spread a thin layer of the dill cream cheese over each tortilla or lettuce leaf.
Lay slices of smoked salmon over the cream cheese (or directly on plastic wrap if not using a base).
If not using a base, arrange salmon slices slightly overlapping on plastic wrap to form a rectangle and spread cream cheese on salmon.
Tightly roll up the tortilla/lettuce/salmon into a log.
Wrap the log tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to firm up.
Unwrap and slice into 1/2-inch to 1-inch thick pinwheels. Serve chilled.
recipes.notes: Recipe 176 - Smoked Salmon Pinwheels with Dill Cream Cheese - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Raspberry Coconut Fat Bombs
recipes.description: Fruity and tropical fat bombs with raspberries and coconut.
ingredients: 1/4 cup fresh or frozen raspberries, mashed or finely chopped
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine softened coconut oil, shredded coconut, mashed/chopped raspberries, powdered sweetener, and vanilla extract (if using).
Mix well until all ingredients are thoroughly combined. The mixture might have a pink hue from the raspberries.
Taste and adjust sweetener if needed.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto a parchment-lined plate or use mini muffin liners/silicone molds.
Freeze for at least 30-60 minutes, or until firm.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer. A refreshing fat bomb option.
recipes.notes: Recipe 177 - Raspberry Coconut Fat Bombs - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Marinated Mushroom Medley
recipes.description: A tangy and flavorful mushroom appetizer or side dish.
ingredients: 1 lb mixed mushrooms (cremini, button, shiitake), cleaned and quartered or halved if large
2 tablespoons red wine vinegar or apple cider vinegar
2 cloves garlic, minced or thinly sliced
1 teaspoon dried Italian herbs (or fresh thyme/rosemary)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: Pinch of red pepper flakes for a little heat
instructions: You can either briefly sauté or blanch the mushrooms first, or marinate them raw for a fresher texture.
For sautéed: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a skillet, sauté mushrooms for 5-7 mins until slightly tender. Let cool.
For raw: Place cleaned and cut mushrooms in a bowl.
In a separate small bowl, whisk together olive oil, vinegar, minced/sliced garlic, Italian herbs, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes (if using).
Pour the marinade over the mushrooms (cooked or raw) and toss well to coat.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1-2 hours, or preferably longer (even overnight), stirring occasionally to allow flavors to meld.
Serve chilled or at room temperature. Great addition to an antipasto platter.
recipes.notes: Recipe 178 - Marinated Mushroom Medley - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Shakshuka (Eggs in Tomato Sauce)
recipes.description: A flavorful Middle Eastern and North African dish of eggs poached in a spicy tomato and pepper sauce.
ingredients: 1 green or red bell pepper, chopped
1 (14.5 oz) can diced tomatoes, undrained (no sugar added)
Pinch of cayenne pepper or red pepper flakes (optional, for heat)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional garnish: Fresh cilantro or parsley, crumbled feta cheese
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet (cast iron works well) over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and bell pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5-7 minutes, until softened.
Stir in minced garlic, paprika, cumin, and cayenne/red pepper flakes (if using). Cook for 1 minute more until fragrant.
Pour in the diced tomatoes (with their juice). Season with salt and pepper. Bring the sauce to a simmer.
Reduce heat to low and let the sauce simmer for 10-15 minutes, allowing it to thicken slightly. Taste and adjust seasonings.
Using the back of a spoon, make small wells in the tomato sauce for the eggs.
Carefully crack an egg into each well.

Cover the skillet and cook for 5-8 minutes, or until the egg whites are set but the yolks are still runny (or cooked to your preference). Alternatively, you can transfer the skillet to a preheated 375°F (190°C) oven for 5-7 minutes.
Serve immediately, straight from the skillet, garnished with fresh cilantro/parsley and feta cheese if desired. A fantastic family breakfast or brunch.
recipes.notes: Recipe 179 - Shakshuka (Eggs in Tomato Sauce) - Breakfast

recipes.name: Blueberry Chia Pudding
recipes.description: A simple and refreshing chia pudding with blueberry flavor.
ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk
1/4 cup fresh or frozen blueberries (mashed slightly if desired)
instructions: In a jar or bowl, combine chia seeds, almond/coconut milk, blueberries (if mashing, do so before adding), sweetener, and vanilla extract.
Whisk or stir very well to combine, ensuring no clumps of chia seeds remain.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2-3 hours, or preferably overnight, until thick.
Stir again before serving. Top with a few extra blueberries or chopped nuts if desired.
recipes.notes: Recipe 180 - Blueberry Chia Pudding - Breakfast

recipes.name: Full English Breakfast (Keto Style)
recipes.description: A hearty and satisfying keto take on the classic Full English breakfast.
ingredients: 2 keto-friendly sausages (check labels for low carb, no fillers)
1/2 cup sliced mushrooms, sautéed in butter
1/4 cup cherry tomatoes, halved and lightly grilled or pan-fried (optional, use sparingly)
Optional: Small portion of black pudding (check carbs carefully if using) or keto bread, toasted
instructions: Cook sausages according to package directions (pan-fry or bake).
In a separate skillet, cook bacon until crispy. Remove bacon and drain on paper towels, reserving some bacon grease if desired.
In the same skillet (with bacon grease or a little butter), cook eggs to your liking (fried, scrambled).
Sauté sliced mushrooms in butter until softened and browned.
Lightly grill or pan-fry halved cherry tomatoes for 1-2 minutes if using.
Arrange all cooked components on a plate: sausages, bacon, eggs, sautéed mushrooms, and tomatoes.
Serve hot. A very filling and family-pleasing breakfast.
recipes.notes: Recipe 181 - Full English Breakfast (Keto Style) - Breakfast

recipes.name: Coconut Cream Coffee
recipes.description: A rich and dairy-free (if using full coconut milk) creamy coffee option.
ingredients: 2-3 tablespoons full-fat canned coconut milk (the thick cream part)
Optional: 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract or a pinch of cinnamon
instructions: Pour hot coffee into a mug.
Add the thick coconut cream from the top of a can of full-fat coconut milk. (Stir the can well before opening if you prefer a more mixed consistency).
Add sweetener if desired, and vanilla extract or cinnamon if using.
Stir well until the coconut cream is melted and combined. For a frothier texture, you can use a milk frother or quickly blend with an immersion blender (be careful with hot liquids).
Serve immediately.
recipes.notes: Recipe 182 - Coconut Cream Coffee - Breakfast

recipes.name: Roasted Red Pepper and Feta Soup
recipes.description: A vibrant and flavorful soup with roasted red peppers and salty feta.
ingredients: 2-3 large red bell peppers, roasted (jarred roasted red peppers work well, about 12-16 oz, drained)
1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese, plus more for garnish
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: Pinch of smoked paprika or fresh basil for garnish
instructions: If roasting fresh peppers: Halve peppers, remove seeds, place cut-side down on a baking sheet, and roast at 400°F (200°C) for 20-25 mins until skin is blistered. Let cool, then peel and roughly chop.
Heat olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add chopped onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute more until fragrant.
Add the roasted red peppers (freshly roasted or jarred) and broth to the pot. Bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 10-15 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
Use an immersion blender to blend the soup until smooth. Alternatively, carefully transfer in batches to a regular blender and blend until smooth, then return to the pot.
Stir in 1/4 cup of crumbled feta cheese until mostly melted into the soup.
Season with salt, pepper, and smoked paprika (if using) to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with additional crumbled feta and fresh basil if desired. A sophisticated but easy soup.
recipes.notes: Recipe 183 - Roasted Red Pepper and Feta Soup - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Simple Green Salad with Avocado and Lemon Dressing
recipes.description: A quick and refreshing green salad with a creamy avocado-lemon dressing.
ingredients: 5 oz mixed greens or romaine lettuce
Optional: A few cherry tomatoes, halved (use sparingly)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Prepare the Avocado Lemon Dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together mashed avocado, olive oil, lemon juice, water (start with 1 tbsp), salt, pepper, and garlic powder (if using) until smooth and creamy. Add more water if needed to reach desired consistency.
In a large salad bowl, combine mixed greens/romaine and sliced/diced cucumber. Add cherry tomatoes if using.
Pour the dressing over the salad ingredients.
Toss gently to ensure everything is evenly coated.
Serve immediately. A very light and healthy side salad.
recipes.notes: Recipe 184 - Simple Green Salad with Avocado and Lemon Dressing - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Salmon Salad (Canned Salmon)
recipes.description: A quick and easy salad using canned salmon, great for lettuce wraps or on its own.
ingredients: 2 (5-6 oz) cans pink or red salmon, drained and flaked
1 tablespoon finely chopped red onion or green onion
1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice or dill pickle juice
1/2 teaspoon dried dill or 1 tablespoon fresh, chopped (optional)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine drained and flaked salmon, mayonnaise, chopped celery, and chopped red/green onion.
Add lemon juice/pickle juice and dill (if using).
Mix gently until all ingredients are well combined.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately, or chill for later. Great served in avocado halves, lettuce cups, or with keto crackers. An easy lunch or light dinner component.
recipes.notes: Recipe 185 - Salmon Salad (Canned Salmon) - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Antipasto Skewers
recipes.description: Colorful and easy-to-assemble skewers, perfect for a party or a fun family meal component.
ingredients: Fresh mozzarella balls (pearls or ciliegine), drained
Salami, pepperoni, or prosciutto, folded or cubed
Optional drizzle: Keto Italian dressing or balsamic glaze (low carb)
instructions: If using wooden skewers, you can soak them in water if you plan to grill them, though these are often served fresh.
Thread the ingredients onto the skewers in an alternating and visually appealing pattern. For example: tomato, mozzarella, folded salami, olive, artichoke heart, basil leaf.
Arrange the completed skewers on a serving platter.
If desired, drizzle lightly with keto Italian dressing or a low-carb balsamic glaze just before serving.
These can be made a few hours ahead and kept chilled. A fun and customizable option.
recipes.notes: Recipe 186 - Antipasto Skewers - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Sheet Pan Fajita Chicken and Veggies
recipes.description: A super simple one-pan meal with all the flavors of fajitas, without the tortillas.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breasts or thighs, sliced into strips
2 bell peppers (any color combination), cored, seeded, and sliced
2 tablespoons olive oil or avocado oil
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional for serving: Lettuce wraps, sour cream, guacamole, salsa, shredded cheese
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a small bowl, mix together all the fajita seasoning ingredients: chili powder, cumin, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne (if using), salt, and pepper.
In a large bowl, combine sliced chicken, sliced bell peppers, and sliced onion. Drizzle with olive oil/avocado oil and toss to coat.
Sprinkle the fajita seasoning mixture over the chicken and vegetables. Toss again until everything is evenly coated.
Spread the chicken and vegetable mixture in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.
Roast for 20-25 minutes, stirring or flipping halfway through, until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender-crisp and slightly charred.
Serve hot directly from the sheet pan. Offer lettuce wraps and other keto-friendly fajita toppings on the side. Very easy and family-friendly.
recipes.notes: Recipe 187 - Sheet Pan Fajita Chicken and Veggies - Main Course

recipes.name: Ground Beef and Green Bean Stir-fry
recipes.description: A quick and flavorful stir-fry using ground beef and fresh green beans.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon sesame oil or avocado oil
1 lb fresh green beans, trimmed and cut into 1-2 inch pieces
1/4 cup soy sauce or coconut aminos
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (e.g., a few drops of stevia, optional)
instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add ground beef (and onion, if using) and cook, breaking it apart, until beef is browned. Drain any excess fat.
Add green beans to the skillet with the beef. Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes, until green beans are tender-crisp.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger to the skillet. Cook for 1 minute more until fragrant.
In a small bowl, whisk together the sauce ingredients: soy sauce/coconut aminos, rice vinegar, and sweetener (if using).
Pour the sauce over the beef and green bean mixture. Stir well to coat everything and cook for another 1-2 minutes until the sauce has slightly thickened.
Serve hot, garnished with sesame seeds if desired. Great over cauliflower rice. A quick weeknight meal.
recipes.notes: Recipe 188 - Ground Beef and Green Bean Stir-fry - Main Course

recipes.name: Pork and Cabbage Skillet with Caraway
recipes.description: A simple and savory one-pan meal with ground pork, cabbage, and caraway seeds.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil or bacon grease
1 small head of cabbage, cored and shredded or roughly chopped
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar for tang
instructions: Heat oil/bacon grease in a large deep skillet or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add ground pork and chopped onion. Cook, breaking up the pork, until it is browned and onion is softened. Drain any excess fat.
Add the shredded/chopped cabbage and caraway seeds to the skillet. Stir well to combine with the pork and onion.
Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5-7 minutes, until the cabbage begins to wilt and soften.
Pour in chicken broth or water. Season with salt and pepper. Add apple cider vinegar if using.
Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the cabbage is tender to your liking. Stir occasionally.
Taste and adjust seasonings if needed.
Serve hot. A hearty and budget-friendly weeknight dish.
recipes.notes: Recipe 189 - Pork and Cabbage Skillet with Caraway - Main Course

recipes.name: Chicken and Asparagus Lemon Stir-fry
recipes.description: A bright and quick stir-fry with chicken, asparagus, and a zesty lemon sauce.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 tablespoon avocado oil or coconut oil
1 lb fresh asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-2 inch pieces
2 tablespoons soy sauce or coconut aminos
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (optional, if lemon is too tart)
Optional garnish: Toasted sesame seeds or sliced almonds
instructions: Season chicken pieces lightly with salt and pepper.
Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add chicken pieces and stir-fry until browned and cooked through. Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
Add asparagus pieces to the same skillet (add a little more oil if needed). Stir-fry for 3-5 minutes, until tender-crisp.
Add minced garlic to the skillet with the asparagus and cook for 1 minute more until fragrant.
In a small bowl, whisk together the sauce ingredients: lemon juice, soy sauce/coconut aminos, ginger (if using), and sweetener (if using).
Return the cooked chicken to the skillet with the asparagus. Pour the sauce over everything.
Stir well to coat and cook for 1-2 minutes, until the sauce has slightly thickened and everything is heated through.
Serve hot, garnished with toasted sesame seeds or almonds if desired. A refreshing and easy meal.
recipes.notes: Recipe 190 - Chicken and Asparagus Lemon Stir-fry - Main Course

recipes.name: Key Lime Pie Fat Bombs
recipes.description: Tangy and creamy fat bombs that capture the flavor of key lime pie.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons fresh lime juice (preferably key lime juice if available)
Optional: 1/4 cup unsweetened shredded coconut or a few drops of green food coloring
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine softened coconut oil, softened cream cheese, powdered sweetener, lime juice, and lime zest.
If using, add shredded coconut or green food coloring.
Beat with an electric mixer or stir vigorously until well combined, smooth, and fluffy.
Taste and adjust sweetener or lime juice if needed for desired tartness.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto a parchment-lined plate or use mini muffin liners/silicone molds.
Freeze for at least 30-60 minutes, or until firm.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer. A zesty and satisfying fat bomb!
recipes.notes: Recipe 191 - Key Lime Pie Fat Bombs - Desserts

recipes.name: Chocolate Silk Pie (No-Bake Crustless)
recipes.description: A rich and decadent chocolate silk pie filling, served crustless or with a keto crust.
ingredients: Optional: 2 oz sugar-free dark chocolate, melted and cooled slightly (for richer flavor)
Optional garnish: Keto whipped cream, sugar-free chocolate shavings
instructions: In a chilled mixing bowl, beat the heavy whipping cream with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form. Set aside.
In a separate medium bowl, beat softened cream cheese with powdered sweetener until smooth and fluffy.
Beat in sifted cocoa powder, vanilla extract, and salt until well combined. If using, beat in the melted and cooled sugar-free dark chocolate.

Gently fold about one-third of the whipped cream into the chocolate cream cheese mixture to lighten it. Then, fold in the remaining whipped cream until just combined and no streaks remain. Be careful not to overmix.
Spoon the chocolate silk pie filling into individual serving dishes, small ramekins, or into a prepared keto pie crust if using.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 2-3 hours, or until firm and well set.
Garnish with additional keto whipped cream and chocolate shavings before serving. A truly decadent family dessert.
recipes.notes: Recipe 192 - Chocolate Silk Pie (No-Bake Crustless) - Desserts

recipes.name: Mascarpone Mousse with Berries
recipes.description: An elegant and rich Italian-style mousse, lighter than cheesecake but just as satisfying.
ingredients: 8 oz mascarpone cheese, at room temperature
1/4 cup keto-friendly powdered sweetener (or to taste)
Optional: Zest of 1/2 lemon or orange (use orange zest sparingly)
instructions: In a medium bowl, gently stir or whisk the room temperature mascarpone cheese until smooth and creamy. Do not overmix mascarpone or it can curdle.
In a separate chilled mixing bowl, beat the heavy whipping cream with an electric mixer until soft peaks form.
Gradually add the powdered sweetener and vanilla extract (and zest, if using) to the whipped cream, continuing to beat until medium-stiff peaks form.
Gently fold about one-third of the whipped cream into the mascarpone cheese to lighten it. Then, carefully fold in the remaining whipped cream until just combined and smooth. Avoid overmixing.
Spoon the mascarpone mousse into individual serving dishes or glasses.
Chill for at least 1-2 hours before serving to allow it to set further.
Serve topped with fresh mixed berries. A sophisticated but easy dessert.
recipes.notes: Recipe 193 - Mascarpone Mousse with Berries - Desserts

recipes.name: Sugar-Free Chocolate Avocado Popsicles
recipes.description: Creamy and rich chocolate popsicles with a hidden healthy ingredient.
ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened almond milk or full-fat coconut milk
1/4 cup keto-friendly sweetener (e.g., erythritol or monk fruit), or to taste
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender: avocado, almond/coconut milk, cocoa powder, sweetener, vanilla extract, and salt.
Blend until completely smooth and creamy. Scrape down the sides as needed.
Taste and adjust sweetener or cocoa powder if necessary.
Pour the mixture evenly into popsicle molds.
Insert popsicle sticks.
Freeze for at least 4-6 hours, or until solid.
To release popsicles, run the molds under warm water for a few seconds. A surprisingly kid-friendly treat!
recipes.notes: Recipe 194 - Sugar-Free Chocolate Avocado Popsicles - Desserts

recipes.name: Peach Iced Tea (Sugar-Free)
recipes.description: A refreshing iced tea with a hint of peach, without the sugar.
ingredients: 4-6 black tea bags (or 4-6 teaspoons loose leaf black tea)
1-2 teaspoons sugar-free peach syrup or peach extract (to taste, ensure keto-friendly)
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (if syrup/extract isn't sweet enough)
Optional: Fresh peach slices (use sparingly for keto) or lemon slices for garnish
instructions: Place tea bags/loose tea in a large heatproof pitcher.
Pour boiling water over the tea. Let steep for 3-5 minutes. Remove tea bags or strain loose tea.
Stir in the sugar-free peach syrup/extract and any additional sweetener while the tea concentrate is still warm.
Add cold water to the pitcher. Stir well.
Refrigerate until thoroughly chilled, or serve immediately over ice.
Garnish with peach or lemon slices if desired. A family favorite for summer.
recipes.notes: Recipe 195 - Peach Iced Tea (Sugar-Free) - Drinks

recipes.name: Creamy Coffee Smoothie
recipes.description: A chilled and creamy coffee-flavored smoothie to start your day or as a pick-me-up.
ingredients: 1/2 cup chilled strong brewed coffee or cold brew concentrate
1/2 cup unsweetened almond milk or heavy cream
1 tablespoon MCT oil or coconut oil (optional, for fats)
1 tablespoon almond butter or peanut butter (optional, for flavor/creaminess)
Optional: 1 scoop vanilla or chocolate keto protein powder
instructions: Combine chilled coffee, almond milk/cream, MCT/coconut oil (if using), almond/peanut butter (if using), sweetener, and protein powder (if using) in a blender.
Add ice cubes.
Blend until smooth, creamy, and frothy.
Taste and adjust sweetener or coffee strength if needed (add more cold brew concentrate or a pinch of instant coffee).
Pour into a glass and serve immediately.
recipes.notes: Recipe 196 - Creamy Coffee Smoothie - Drinks

recipes.name: Lime Mint Slushie (Sugar-Free)
recipes.description: A super refreshing and icy drink, perfect for cooling down.
ingredients: 1/4 cup fresh mint leaves, loosely packed
1-2 cups ice cubes (more for a thicker slushie)
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (liquid works best, e.g., stevia or erythritol syrup)
Optional: Lime zest for extra flavor
instructions: Combine lime juice, fresh mint leaves, ice cubes, cold water, and sweetener in a high-powered blender.
Add lime zest if using.
Blend on high speed until the ice is finely crushed and the mixture has a smooth, slushy consistency. You may need to stop and stir or add a tiny bit more water if it's too thick for your blender.
Taste and adjust sweetener or lime juice if needed.
Pour into glasses and serve immediately with a straw. Very refreshing on a hot day.
recipes.notes: Recipe 197 - Lime Mint Slushie (Sugar-Free) - Drinks

recipes.name: Ginger Ale (Homemade Sugar-Free)
recipes.description: A bubbly and spicy homemade ginger ale without the sugar.
ingredients: 1/4 cup keto-friendly granulated sweetener (e.g., erythritol, allulose)
2-3 inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and thinly sliced or grated
2-3 tablespoons prepared ginger syrup (or to taste)
1 cup sparkling water or club soda, chilled
instructions: Prepare the Ginger Syrup: In a small saucepan, combine water, sweetener, and sliced/grated ginger. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, stirring until the sweetener dissolves.
Reduce heat to low and let simmer gently for 10-15 minutes to infuse the ginger flavor. Do not let it boil vigorously.
Remove from heat and let the syrup cool completely. Strain out the ginger pieces. Store the syrup in an airtight container in the refrigerator (lasts about 1-2 weeks).
Assemble the Ginger Ale: Fill a glass with ice cubes.
Add 2-3 tablespoons of the cooled ginger syrup (or more, to your taste).
Top with chilled sparkling water or club soda.
Add a squeeze of lime juice if desired.
Stir gently and serve immediately.
recipes.notes: Recipe 198 - Ginger Ale (Homemade Sugar-Free) - Drinks

recipes.name: Chocolate Hazelnut Fat Bombs (Nutella-like)
recipes.description: Rich and decadent fat bombs with a chocolate hazelnut flavor, reminiscent of Nutella.
ingredients: 1/4 cup unsweetened hazelnut butter (or make your own by blending roasted hazelnuts)
Optional: 1-2 tablespoons heavy cream for extra creaminess, or a few drops of hazelnut extract for stronger flavor
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine softened butter, hazelnut butter, powdered sweetener, cocoa powder, vanilla extract, and salt.
If using, add heavy cream or hazelnut extract.
Beat with an electric mixer or stir vigorously until all ingredients are well combined and the mixture is smooth and fluffy.
Taste and adjust sweetener, cocoa, or hazelnut flavor if needed.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto a parchment-lined plate or use mini muffin liners/silicone molds.
Freeze for at least 30-60 minutes, or until firm.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer. A perfect rich treat!
recipes.notes: Recipe 199 - Chocolate Hazelnut Fat Bombs (Nutella-like) - Desserts

recipes.name: Garlic Parmesan Roasted Broccoli and Sausage
recipes.description: A simple and flavorful one-pan meal with roasted broccoli and smoked sausage, topped with garlic and Parmesan.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs smoked sausage (like Kielbasa or Andouille, check for low sugar), sliced into 1/2-inch rounds
2 large heads of broccoli, cut into medium florets (about 6-8 cups)
1/4 cup olive oil or avocado oil
Optional: Pinch of red pepper flakes for a little heat
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper for easy cleanup.
In a large bowl, combine broccoli florets and sliced sausage.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil (or avocado oil), minced garlic, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes (if using).
Pour the oil and garlic mixture over the broccoli and sausage. Toss well to ensure everything is evenly coated.
Spread the broccoli and sausage mixture in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Try not to overcrowd; use two sheets if necessary.
Roast for 15 minutes.
Remove the baking sheet from the oven, stir the broccoli and sausage, and sprinkle evenly with grated Parmesan cheese.

Return to the oven and roast for another 5-10 minutes, or until the broccoli is tender-crisp and slightly charred at the edges, the sausage is heated through, and the Parmesan is melted and lightly golden.
Serve hot directly from the sheet pan. This is a very quick and satisfying weeknight meal.
recipes.notes: Recipe 200 - Garlic Parmesan Roasted Broccoli and Sausage - Main Course

recipes.name: Avocado Egg Boats
recipes.description: Nutrient-dense and satisfying baked avocado halves filled with eggs and your favorite toppings.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional toppings: 2 slices cooked bacon (crumbled), 1 tablespoon chopped chives, shredded cheese, everything bagel seasoning
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Halve the avocados lengthwise and remove the pits.
Scoop out a small amount of avocado flesh from the center of each half to make a well large enough to hold an egg. (You can save the scooped avocado for another use).
Place the avocado halves in a baking dish or on a baking sheet, ensuring they are stable (you can slice a tiny bit off the bottom to make them sit flat).
Carefully crack one egg into the well of each avocado half.
Season with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle with desired optional toppings like crumbled bacon, chives, or cheese.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the egg whites are set but the yolks are still slightly runny (or cooked to your preference).
Let cool slightly before serving.
recipes.notes: Recipe 201 - Avocado Egg Boats - Breakfast

recipes.name: Sausage and Cheese Stuffed Mushrooms
recipes.description: Savory mushrooms stuffed with a delicious mixture of keto sausage and cheese.
ingredients: 1 lb large cremini or white button mushrooms
1/2 lb ground keto-friendly sausage (e.g., Italian or breakfast sausage, no sugar added)
1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley or 1 teaspoon dried Italian seasoning
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: 2 tablespoons olive oil for brushing mushroom caps
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Clean mushrooms and gently remove the stems. Finely chop the stems.
If desired, lightly brush the mushroom caps with olive oil and place them cavity-side up in a baking dish.
In a skillet over medium heat, cook the ground sausage until browned, breaking it apart with a spoon. Drain any excess fat.
Add the chopped mushroom stems and minced garlic to the skillet with the sausage. Cook for 3-5 minutes until stems are softened.
Remove from heat. Stir in the softened cream cheese, grated Parmesan cheese, parsley or Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. Mix until well combined.
Spoon the sausage and cheese mixture generously into each mushroom cap.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and the filling is hot and lightly browned.
Let cool slightly before serving.
recipes.notes: Recipe 202 - Sausage and Cheese Stuffed Mushrooms - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Prosciutto-Wrapped Asparagus
recipes.description: Tender asparagus spears wrapped in salty prosciutto, a simple and elegant appetizer or side.
ingredients: 1 lb fresh asparagus spears, tough ends trimmed
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Wash and trim the asparagus spears.
Wrap each asparagus spear (or a small bundle of 2-3 thinner spears) with a slice of prosciutto, starting from the bottom and spiraling up.
Arrange the prosciutto-wrapped asparagus in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.
Drizzle lightly with olive oil and sprinkle with black pepper if desired (prosciutto is already salty).
Bake for 10-15 minutes, or until the prosciutto is slightly crispy and the asparagus is tender-crisp. Cooking time will depend on the thickness of the asparagus.
Serve warm or at room temperature.
recipes.notes: Recipe 203 - Prosciutto-Wrapped Asparagus - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Everything Bagel Seasoning Fat Bombs
recipes.description: Savory fat bombs with cream cheese and the delicious flavor of everything bagel seasoning.
ingredients: 2-3 tablespoons Everything Bagel Seasoning, plus more for rolling (optional)
Optional: 1/4 cup shredded sharp cheddar cheese
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine softened cream cheese and softened butter. Beat with an electric mixer or stir vigorously until smooth and well combined.
Stir in 2-3 tablespoons of Everything Bagel Seasoning and shredded cheddar cheese (if using). Mix until evenly distributed.
Chill the mixture in the refrigerator for about 20-30 minutes to firm up slightly, making it easier to roll.
Roll the mixture into small balls (about 1 inch in diameter).
If desired, roll the formed fat bombs in additional Everything Bagel Seasoning for an extra coating.
Place on a parchment-lined plate and freeze for at least 30 minutes, or until firm.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer.
recipes.notes: Recipe 204 - Everything Bagel Seasoning Fat Bombs - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Simple Cream Cheese Pancakes
recipes.description: Delicate and slightly sweet keto pancakes made primarily with cream cheese and eggs.
ingredients: 4 oz cream cheese, full-fat, softened to room temperature
1-2 tablespoons keto-friendly sweetener (e.g., powdered erythritol, or to taste)
Butter or coconut oil for greasing the skillet
instructions: In a blender or using a hand mixer, combine softened cream cheese, eggs, sweetener, vanilla extract, and cinnamon (if using).
Blend or beat until the batter is completely smooth and no lumps of cream cheese remain.
Let the batter rest for a couple of minutes.
Heat a lightly buttered or oiled non-stick skillet or griddle over medium-low heat.
Pour small circles of batter (about 2-3 tablespoons each, or 3-4 inches in diameter) onto the hot skillet. These pancakes are thinner and more delicate than traditional flour-based pancakes.
Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown and set. Flip carefully with a thin spatula.
Serve warm with butter, keto-friendly syrup, fresh berries, or whipped cream.
recipes.notes: Recipe 205 - Simple Cream Cheese Pancakes - Breakfast

recipes.name: 90-Second Microwave Bread
recipes.description: A super quick single-serving keto bread made in the microwave, perfect for a quick toast or sandwich base.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons almond flour (or 1 tablespoon coconut flour - may need slight liquid adjustment)
instructions: In a microwave-safe mug, ramekin (about 4 inches wide), or small square/round microwaveable container, melt the butter or coconut oil (about 20-30 seconds).
Add the almond flour (or coconut flour), egg, baking powder, and salt to the melted butter in the mug.
Mix thoroughly with a fork until a smooth batter forms, ensuring there are no lumps.
Microwave on high for 90 seconds. (Microwave times can vary; if it seems wet, add 10-15 more seconds). The bread will puff up and should be cooked through.
Let cool in the mug for a minute or two, then carefully run a knife around the edges and tip it out onto a plate.
You can slice it in half (like a muffin) and toast it if desired. Use for sandwiches, with butter, or as a side.
recipes.notes: Recipe 206 - 90-Second Microwave Bread - Breakfast

recipes.name: Homemade Keto Granola
recipes.description: Crunchy, homemade keto granola packed with nuts and seeds, perfect with keto yogurt or almond milk.
ingredients: 1 cup mixed raw nuts (e.g., almonds, pecans, walnuts, chopped or slivered)
1/2 cup mixed raw seeds (e.g., pumpkin seeds, sunflower seeds, hemp hearts)
2-3 tablespoons keto-friendly granulated sweetener (e.g., erythritol or monk fruit blend)
2 tablespoons melted coconut oil or butter
Optional: 1 tablespoon chia seeds or flaxseed meal
instructions: Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C). Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine the mixed nuts, seeds, shredded coconut, sweetener, cinnamon, and salt. Add chia/flax if using. Stir to mix.
In a small bowl, whisk together the melted coconut oil (or butter) and vanilla extract.
Pour the wet ingredients over the dry ingredients and stir well until everything is evenly coated.
Spread the granola mixture in a thin, even layer on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, stirring gently halfway through, until the granola is golden brown and fragrant. Watch carefully in the last few minutes to prevent burning.
Remove from oven and let the granola cool completely on the baking sheet without stirring. It will crisp up as it cools.
Once cooled, break into clusters or pieces. Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1-2 weeks.
recipes.notes: Recipe 207 - Homemade Keto Granola - Breakfast

recipes.name: Zucchini Fritters with Garlic Aioli
recipes.description: Savory zucchini fritters, perfect as an appetizer, side, or light meal, served with a simple garlic aioli.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley or chives
Freshly ground black pepper to taste
2-3 tablespoons olive oil or avocado oil for frying
1 small clove garlic, minced or pressed
instructions: Prepare Zucchini: Place grated zucchini in a colander over a bowl. Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon of salt and let sit for 20-30 minutes to draw out excess moisture. Squeeze the zucchini very well (using your hands, a clean kitchen towel, or cheesecloth) to remove as much liquid as possible. This is crucial for crispy fritters.
Make Fritter Batter: In a medium bowl, combine the squeezed zucchini, beaten egg, almond flour, Parmesan cheese, parsley/chives, garlic powder, and black pepper. Mix until well combined.
Cook Fritters: Heat olive oil or avocado oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Drop spoonfuls (about 2 tablespoons each) of the zucchini mixture into the hot skillet, flattening them slightly with the back of the spoon to form small patties.
Cook for 3-5 minutes per side, until golden brown, crispy, and cooked through. Do not overcrowd the pan; cook in batches if necessary.
Transfer cooked fritters to a paper towel-lined plate to drain any excess oil.
Make Garlic Aioli: In a small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, minced/pressed garlic, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt until smooth.
Serve zucchini fritters warm with the garlic aioli for dipping. These are great for family snacking or as a side.
recipes.notes: Recipe 208 - Zucchini Fritters with Garlic Aioli - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Sausage and Kale Soup (Zuppa Toscana Style)
recipes.description: A keto version of the popular Italian sausage, kale, and 'potato' soup, using cauliflower for texture.
ingredients: 1 lb keto-friendly Italian sausage (mild or spicy, casings removed if in links)
1 tablespoon olive oil or bacon grease
1 small head cauliflower, cut into small, bite-sized florets
1 bunch kale, stems removed and leaves chopped (about 4-5 cups)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: Pinch of red pepper flakes for heat, grated Parmesan cheese for serving
instructions: Heat olive oil or bacon grease in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add the Italian sausage and cook, breaking it apart with a spoon, until browned. If using onion, add it with the sausage and cook until softened. Drain any excess fat if necessary.
Stir in minced garlic and cook for 1 minute more until fragrant.
Pour in chicken broth and add the cauliflower florets. Bring to a simmer.
Cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the cauliflower is tender.
Stir in the chopped kale and cook for another 3-5 minutes, until the kale is wilted and tender.
Reduce heat to low. Stir in the heavy cream. Heat through gently, but do not let the soup boil after adding the cream.
Season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes (if using) to taste.
Ladle into bowls and serve hot, garnished with grated Parmesan cheese if desired. A hearty and comforting family soup.
recipes.notes: Recipe 209 - Sausage and Kale Soup (Zuppa Toscana Style) - Soups and Salads

recipes.name: Butter Chicken (Simplified Keto)
recipes.description: A rich and creamy keto version of the classic Indian butter chicken, simplified for a weeknight.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs boneless, skinless chicken thighs or breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces
1/4 cup full-fat plain Greek yogurt (check carbs) or coconut cream
1 (14.5 oz) can tomato sauce or crushed tomatoes (no sugar added)
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (optional, to balance acidity)
instructions: Marinate Chicken: In a bowl, combine chicken pieces with all marinade ingredients (yogurt/coconut cream, lemon juice, ginger, garlic, garam masala, turmeric, salt). Mix well, cover, and refrigerate for at least 20-30 minutes (or up to a few hours).

Cook Chicken: Heat 1 tablespoon of butter/ghee in a large skillet or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add marinated chicken (shake off excess marinade) and cook in batches until browned on all sides and mostly cooked through. Remove chicken and set aside.
Make Sauce: In the same skillet, add the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter/ghee. If using onion, add it and cook until softened (about 3-5 minutes).
Stir in tomato sauce/crushed tomatoes, 1 teaspoon garam masala, and ground cumin. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Reduce heat to low. Stir in heavy cream and sweetener (if using). Simmer gently for another 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly.
Return the cooked chicken to the sauce. Stir to coat and simmer for 5 more minutes, or until chicken is heated through and tender.
Taste and adjust seasonings if needed.
Garnish with fresh chopped cilantro. Serve hot with cauliflower rice or keto naan bread. A family favorite.
recipes.notes: Recipe 210 - Butter Chicken (Simplified Keto) - Main Course

recipes.name: Zucchini Noodle Lasagna Bake
recipes.description: A low-carb lasagna using zucchini slices instead of pasta, layered with a savory meat sauce and rich cheese filling.
ingredients: 2-3 medium zucchinis, thinly sliced lengthwise (about 1/8-inch thick, a mandoline works best)
1 lb ground beef or Italian sausage
1.5 cups keto-friendly marinara sauce (no sugar added)
15 oz whole milk ricotta cheese (check carbs)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Fresh basil or parsley, chopped (for garnish)
instructions: Prepare Zucchini: Lay zucchini slices on paper towels, sprinkle lightly with salt, and let sit for 15-20 minutes to draw out excess moisture. Pat dry thoroughly with paper towels.

Make Meat Sauce: In a large skillet, cook ground beef/sausage and onion (if using) over medium heat until meat is browned. Drain any excess fat. Stir in minced garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add marinara sauce and Italian seasoning. Simmer for 10-15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Prepare Cheese Filling: In a medium bowl, combine ricotta cheese, beaten egg, Parmesan cheese, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Mix well.
Assemble Lasagna: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Spread a thin layer of meat sauce in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Arrange a layer of zucchini slices over the sauce, slightly overlapping them.
Spread half of the ricotta cheese mixture over the zucchini.
Top with half of the remaining meat sauce, then half of the shredded mozzarella cheese.
Repeat layers: zucchini, remaining ricotta, remaining meat sauce, and remaining mozzarella cheese.
Bake: Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes. Remove foil and bake for another 15-20 minutes, or until bubbly and the cheese is melted and golden brown.
Let Rest: Let the lasagna rest for 10-15 minutes before slicing and serving. This helps it hold its shape. Garnish with fresh basil or parsley.
recipes.notes: Recipe 211 - Zucchini Noodle Lasagna Bake - Main Course

recipes.name: Pan-Seared Scallops with Lemon Caper Sauce
recipes.description: Tender and perfectly seared scallops in a simple yet elegant lemon butter and caper sauce.
ingredients: 1 lb large sea scallops, side muscle removed
1/4 cup chicken broth or dry white wine (optional)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Thoroughly pat the scallops dry with paper towels (this is crucial for a good sear). Season lightly with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil and 1 tablespoon of butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat until the butter is melted and the oil is shimmering.

Add scallops to the hot skillet in a single layer, ensuring they are not overcrowded (cook in batches if necessary). Sear for 1.5-2 minutes per side without moving them, until a golden-brown crust forms and they are opaque. Do not overcook.
Remove scallops from the skillet and set aside on a plate.
Reduce heat to medium-low. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter to the skillet. Once melted, add minced garlic and cook for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
If using, deglaze the pan by pouring in chicken broth or white wine, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the skillet. Let it simmer for 1 minute.
Stir in fresh lemon juice and capers. Cook for another minute.
Return the seared scallops to the skillet with the sauce. Add chopped fresh parsley. Toss gently to coat the scallops with the sauce and heat through.
Serve immediately. This is a sophisticated dish that's surprisingly quick.
recipes.notes: Recipe 212 - Pan-Seared Scallops with Lemon Caper Sauce - Main Course

recipes.name: Hearty Keto Chili (No Beans)
recipes.description: A flavorful and satisfying beanless chili, perfect for a comforting family meal.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs ground beef (or a mix of beef and keto-friendly sausage)
1 tablespoon olive oil or avocado oil
1 (14.5 oz) can diced tomatoes, undrained (no sugar added)
2-3 tablespoons chili powder (adjust to taste, check for fillers)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional toppings: Shredded cheddar cheese, sour cream, sliced avocado, chopped green onions, jalapeños
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add ground beef (and onion/bell pepper if using). Cook, breaking up the meat, until browned. Drain any excess fat.
Stir in minced garlic, chili powder, cumin, smoked paprika, and oregano. Cook for 1-2 minutes more, until fragrant.
Add diced tomatoes (with their juice), tomato paste, and beef broth. Stir well to combine.
Season with salt and pepper.
Bring the chili to a simmer. Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for at least 30 minutes (or up to 1-2 hours for flavors to meld more deeply), stirring occasionally.
Taste and adjust seasonings if needed (more chili powder, salt, etc.).
Ladle into bowls and serve hot with your favorite keto toppings. This is great for a weeknight or a crowd.
recipes.notes: Recipe 213 - Hearty Keto Chili (No Beans) - Main Course

recipes.name: Family-Style Swedish Meatballs with Cauliflower Rice
recipes.description: Flavorful keto meatballs in a creamy gravy, served over cauliflower rice for a satisfying family meal.
ingredients: 1 lb ground beef (or a 50/50 mix of ground beef and ground pork)
1/4 cup almond flour or crushed pork rinds
1 small onion, very finely chopped or grated (optional)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
1-2 tablespoons butter or avocado oil for frying
1-2 teaspoons almond flour or 1/4 tsp xanthan gum (optional, for thickening)
1 tablespoon soy sauce or coconut aminos
For Serving: Steamed cauliflower rice, fresh parsley (chopped)
instructions: Make Meatballs: In a large bowl, gently combine ground meat(s), almond flour/pork rinds, finely chopped/grated onion (if using), beaten egg, allspice, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Do not overmix.
Roll the mixture into small meatballs (about 1-1.5 inches in diameter).

Heat 1-2 tablespoons of butter/oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Brown the meatballs in batches on all sides. Remove cooked meatballs from the skillet and set aside (they don't need to be cooked through at this stage).
Make Gravy: In the same skillet (do not wipe clean), melt 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat.
If using almond flour for thickening, whisk it into the melted butter and cook for 1 minute. If using xanthan gum, you'll add it later.
Gradually whisk in the beef broth, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan. Bring to a simmer.
Stir in heavy cream, soy sauce/coconut aminos, and Dijon mustard. Let the gravy simmer for 5-7 minutes, or until it begins to thicken slightly.
If using xanthan gum, sprinkle it very lightly over the simmering gravy while whisking constantly until desired thickness is reached.
Season the gravy with salt and pepper to taste.

Return the browned meatballs to the skillet with the gravy. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer gently for 10-15 minutes, or until the meatballs are cooked through and the gravy has thickened further.
Serve hot over steamed cauliflower rice, garnished with fresh chopped parsley. This is a comforting family meal.
recipes.notes: Recipe 214 - Family-Style Swedish Meatballs with Cauliflower Rice - Main Course

recipes.name: Chicken Cordon Bleu Bake
recipes.description: All the classic flavors of Chicken Cordon Bleu in a simple, family-friendly casserole form.
ingredients: 2 cups cooked chicken, diced or shredded (rotisserie chicken works well)
1 cup diced deli ham (check for low sugar)
4 oz cream cheese, softened and cubed
1 cup shredded Swiss cheese (or Gruyère), divided
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional topping: 1/4 cup crushed pork rinds mixed with 1 tablespoon melted butter
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease a medium baking dish (approx. 8x8 or 9x7 inch).
Spread the diced or shredded cooked chicken evenly in the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
Scatter the diced ham over the chicken.
In a small saucepan over medium-low heat, combine cubed cream cheese, heavy cream, chicken broth, and Dijon mustard. Whisk frequently until the cream cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth.
Stir in 1/2 cup of the shredded Swiss cheese until melted. Season the sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
Pour the cheese sauce evenly over the chicken and ham in the baking dish.
Sprinkle the remaining 1/2 cup of shredded Swiss cheese over the top.
If using the optional topping, sprinkle the pork rind mixture over the cheese.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the casserole is bubbly around the edges and the topping is golden brown (if using pork rinds).
Let cool for 5-10 minutes before serving. This is a rich and satisfying weeknight meal.
recipes.notes: Recipe 215 - Chicken Cordon Bleu Bake - Main Course

recipes.name: Blackened Fish with Avocado Salsa
recipes.description: Spicy blackened white fish fillets topped with a refreshing and creamy avocado salsa.
ingredients: 1 small jalapeño, minced (optional, seeds removed for less heat)
4 white fish fillets (e.g., tilapia, cod, mahi-mahi, about 4-6 oz each)
1-2 tablespoons blackened seasoning (ensure sugar-free, or make your own: paprika, cayenne, garlic powder, onion powder, thyme, oregano, salt, pepper)
1-2 tablespoons olive oil or avocado oil for cooking
instructions: Prepare Avocado Salsa: In a small bowl, gently combine diced avocado, diced red onion, chopped cilantro, minced jalapeño (if using), lime juice, and salt. Mix carefully to avoid mashing the avocado too much. Set aside (can be made shortly before serving).
Prepare Fish: Pat the fish fillets very dry with paper towels.
Generously coat all sides of each fish fillet with the blackened seasoning, pressing it on slightly to adhere.
Cook Fish: Heat olive oil or avocado oil in a large skillet (cast iron is ideal) over medium-high heat until the oil is hot and shimmering.

Carefully place the seasoned fish fillets in the hot skillet. Cook for 3-5 minutes per side, depending on the thickness of the fish, until the seasoning is well-blackened (but not burnt) and the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
Serve the blackened fish fillets immediately, topped generously with the fresh avocado salsa. A quick and flavorful weeknight meal.
recipes.notes: Recipe 216 - Blackened Fish with Avocado Salsa - Main Course

recipes.name: Easy Pulled Pork (Slow Cooker)
recipes.description: Tender and flavorful pulled pork made with minimal effort in a slow cooker, perfect for keto BBQ.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon erythritol or other keto granulated sweetener (optional)
For Serving: Sugar-free BBQ sauce, keto coleslaw, keto buns or lettuce wraps
instructions: Prepare Pork: Pat the pork shoulder dry with paper towels.
Make Dry Rub: In a small bowl, combine all dry rub ingredients (smoked paprika, sweetener, salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne).
Rub the spice mixture thoroughly all over the pork shoulder.
Slow Cook: Place the seasoned pork shoulder in the slow cooker. If using braising liquid, pour apple cider vinegar and water/broth around the roast (not directly over the rub if possible).
Cover and cook on LOW for 6-8 hours or on HIGH for 3-4 hours, until the pork is very tender and easily shreds with a fork.
Shred Pork: Remove the pork from the slow cooker and place it on a large cutting board or in a large bowl. Let it rest for 10-15 minutes.
Using two forks, shred the pork, discarding any large pieces of fat or bone (if bone-in).
Serve: You can return the shredded pork to some of the cooking juices in the slow cooker to keep it moist, or serve it as is. Toss with your favorite sugar-free BBQ sauce before serving.
Serve in lettuce wraps, on keto-friendly buns, with keto coleslaw, or as part of a larger meal. Great for feeding a family or for meal prep.
recipes.notes: Recipe 217 - Easy Pulled Pork (Slow Cooker) - Main Course

recipes.name: Philly Cheesesteak Stuffed Peppers
recipes.description: Bell peppers stuffed with all the classic Philly cheesesteak ingredients.
ingredients: 3-4 large bell peppers (any color), halved lengthwise and seeded
1 lb thinly sliced beef (e.g., ribeye, sirloin, or pre-sliced cheesesteak meat)
1 tablespoon olive oil or avocado oil
Optional: 1/2 green bell pepper, thinly sliced (if not using all peppers for stuffing)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
4-6 slices provolone cheese (or Cheez Whiz if you have a keto-friendly version/preference)
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
If desired, par-boil or microwave the bell pepper halves for 3-5 minutes until slightly tender. Drain.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add thinly sliced beef and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned. Season with salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Remove beef from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add sliced onion (and green pepper/mushrooms, if using). Cook, stirring, until softened and lightly caramelized (about 5-8 minutes).
Return the cooked beef to the skillet with the vegetables. Stir to combine and heat through.
Spoon the beef and vegetable mixture evenly into the bell pepper halves.
Top each stuffed pepper half with a slice (or torn pieces) of provolone cheese.
Place the stuffed peppers in a baking dish. You can add about 1/4 inch of water or broth to the bottom of the dish to help steam the peppers.
Bake for 15-25 minutes (less time if peppers were pre-cooked), or until the peppers are tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Let cool slightly before serving. A satisfying family meal.
recipes.notes: Recipe 218 - Philly Cheesesteak Stuffed Peppers - Main Course

recipes.name: Coconut Curry Chicken Soup
recipes.description: A rich and aromatic soup with chicken and vegetables in a creamy coconut curry broth.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon coconut oil or avocado oil
1 lb boneless, skinless chicken thighs or breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
1-2 tablespoons red curry paste (check for sugar, adjust to spice preference)
1 cup chopped keto-friendly vegetables (e.g., broccoli florets, sliced bell peppers, mushrooms, green beans)
Fresh cilantro or basil, chopped (for garnish)
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned on all sides. Remove chicken and set aside.
If using onion, add it to the pot and cook until softened (about 3-5 minutes). Add minced garlic and grated ginger, cook for 1 minute more until fragrant.
Stir in the red curry paste and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Pour in chicken broth and coconut milk. Whisk to combine and bring to a gentle simmer.
Add the chopped keto-friendly vegetables and the cooked chicken back to the pot.
Simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the chicken is cooked through.
Stir in the lime juice. Season with salt to taste.
Ladle into bowls and serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro or basil. A flavorful and comforting weeknight option.
recipes.notes: Recipe 219 - Coconut Curry Chicken Soup - Main Course

recipes.name: Easy Chicken Piccata
recipes.description: Tender chicken cutlets in a tangy lemon-butter and caper sauce, simplified for a quick meal.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breasts, pounded thin or cut into thin cutlets
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional: 2-3 tablespoons almond flour for dredging
instructions: Season chicken cutlets on both sides with salt and pepper. If using, lightly dredge them in almond flour, shaking off any excess.
Heat olive oil and 1 tablespoon of butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.

Add chicken cutlets to the hot skillet (do not overcrowd; cook in batches if needed). Cook for 2-4 minutes per side, until golden brown and cooked through. Remove chicken from skillet and set aside on a plate.
Reduce heat to medium. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter to the skillet. Once melted, add minced garlic and cook for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in chicken broth and lemon juice, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan. Bring the sauce to a simmer and let it reduce slightly for 2-3 minutes.
Stir in the drained capers and most of the chopped fresh parsley (reserve some for garnish).
Return the cooked chicken cutlets to the skillet with the sauce. Spoon some of the sauce over the chicken. Let it simmer for another 1-2 minutes to heat through.
Serve immediately, garnished with the remaining fresh parsley. Great with zoodles or steamed asparagus.
recipes.notes: Recipe 220 - Easy Chicken Piccata - Main Course

recipes.name: Keto Stuffed Cabbage Rolls
recipes.description: Cabbage leaves stuffed with a savory meat and cauliflower rice mixture, baked in a flavorful tomato sauce.
ingredients: 1 large head of green cabbage (about 12-16 leaves needed)
1 lb ground beef (or a mix of ground beef and pork)
1 (14.5 oz) can diced tomatoes or crushed tomatoes (no sugar added)
1 teaspoon dried oregano or Italian seasoning
Keto-friendly sweetener to taste (optional, to balance tomato acidity)
instructions: Prepare Cabbage Leaves: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Core the cabbage. Place the whole cabbage, core-side down, into the boiling water. Cover and cook for 3-5 minutes. Gently peel off the softened outer leaves. Repeat until you have 12-16 pliable leaves. Shave down the thick rib on each leaf to make rolling easier.
Make Filling: In a large bowl, combine ground meat, riced cauliflower, chopped onion (if using), beaten egg, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Mix gently until just combined (do not overmix).

Assemble Rolls: Lay a cabbage leaf flat. Place about 1/4 to 1/3 cup of the meat mixture near the stem end of the leaf. Fold in the sides of the cabbage leaf over the filling, then roll up tightly from the stem end.

Prepare Baking Dish: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). In a small bowl, whisk together diced/crushed tomatoes, beef broth/water, tomato paste, and oregano/Italian seasoning. Add sweetener if desired. Pour about half of this sauce into the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish (or a Dutch oven).
Arrange the cabbage rolls seam-down in a single layer (or two if needed) in the baking dish over the sauce.
Pour the remaining tomato sauce evenly over the cabbage rolls.
Bake: Cover the baking dish tightly with foil. Bake for 50-60 minutes, or until the meat filling is cooked through and the cabbage is very tender.
Let rest for 10 minutes before serving. Serve with the sauce from the dish. A classic comfort food made keto.
recipes.notes: Recipe 221 - Keto Stuffed Cabbage Rolls - Main Course

recipes.name: Addictive Crack Chicken
recipes.description: Creamy, cheesy, bacon-ranch chicken that's incredibly popular and easy to make in a slow cooker or Instant Pot.
ingredients: 2 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breasts or thighs

1 oz packet dry ranch seasoning mix (check for low sugar/no maltodextrin, or use homemade: 2 tbsp dried parsley, 1 tsp dried dill, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp onion powder, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp pepper)
Optional: 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese (stir in at the end or sprinkle on top)
instructions: Slow Cooker Method:
Place chicken in the bottom of the slow cooker.
Top with cubed cream cheese and sprinkle with ranch seasoning mix.
Scatter half of the crumbled bacon over the top.
Cover and cook on LOW for 4-6 hours or on HIGH for 2-3 hours, until chicken is tender and easily shreds.
Instant Pot Method:
Place chicken in the Instant Pot. Add about 1/4 cup of water or chicken broth (for pressure building).
Top with cubed cream cheese and sprinkle with ranch seasoning mix. Scatter half of the crumbled bacon.

Secure the lid, set the valve to sealing. Cook on HIGH pressure for 12-15 minutes for breasts, 10-12 for thighs. Allow a 5-10 minute natural pressure release, then quick release any remaining pressure.
Shred and Serve:
Remove chicken from the slow cooker/Instant Pot and shred it using two forks.
Return the shredded chicken to the pot with the creamy sauce. Stir well to combine everything. The cream cheese should melt into a sauce.
Stir in the remaining crumbled bacon and optional shredded cheddar cheese until cheese is melted.
Serve hot in lettuce wraps, on keto buns, with celery sticks, over cauliflower rice, or as a dip. A guaranteed family pleaser.
recipes.notes: Recipe 222 - Addictive Crack Chicken - Main Course

recipes.name: Crispy Baked Garlic Parmesan Wings
recipes.description: Extra crispy baked chicken wings tossed in a savory garlic Parmesan sauce, perfect for game day or a weeknight treat.
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken wings (flats and drumettes separated)
1 tablespoon baking powder (NOT baking soda - this makes them crispy)
Optional: Pinch of red pepper flakes
instructions: Prepare Wings: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper and place an oven-safe wire rack on top.
Pat the chicken wings thoroughly dry with paper towels. This is key for crispiness.
In a large bowl, toss the dry wings with baking powder, salt, and pepper until evenly coated.
Arrange the wings in a single layer on the prepared wire rack, ensuring they are not touching.
Bake: Bake for 40-50 minutes, flipping the wings halfway through, until they are golden brown, crispy, and cooked through (internal temperature of 165°F or 74°C).

Make Sauce: While the wings are baking (or in the last 5-10 minutes), prepare the sauce. In a small bowl, whisk together melted butter, minced garlic, grated Parmesan cheese, and chopped fresh parsley. Add red pepper flakes if desired.
Toss Wings: Once the wings are cooked and crispy, transfer them to a large clean bowl. Pour the garlic Parmesan sauce over the hot wings and toss gently until all wings are evenly coated.
Serve immediately. These are always a family hit!
recipes.notes: Recipe 223 - Crispy Baked Garlic Parmesan Wings - Main Course

recipes.name: Meatza (All Meat Pizza Crust)
recipes.description: A pizza where the crust is made entirely of seasoned ground meat, topped like a traditional pizza.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs ground beef (or a mix of ground beef and Italian sausage, casings removed)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
1/2 cup keto-friendly pizza sauce or marinara (no sugar added)
Your favorite keto pizza toppings (e.g., pepperoni, cooked mushrooms, olives, sliced bell peppers)
instructions: Prepare Meat Crust: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a large pizza pan or baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, gently combine the ground meat, beaten egg, Parmesan cheese, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Be careful not to overmix.
Transfer the meat mixture to the prepared parchment paper. Press it out evenly into a round or rectangular pizza crust shape, about 1/4 to 1/2-inch thick.
Bake the meat crust for 15-20 minutes, or until it is mostly cooked through and browned. Carefully drain off any excess fat that has rendered from the crust.
Add Toppings: Remove the meat crust from the oven. Spread the keto-friendly pizza sauce evenly over the surface.
Sprinkle generously with shredded mozzarella cheese, then arrange your desired keto toppings over the cheese.
Bake Again: Return the 'Meatza' to the oven and bake for another 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted, bubbly, and lightly golden, and the toppings are heated through.
Let cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving. A very hearty and satisfying family meal.
recipes.notes: Recipe 224 - Meatza (All Meat Pizza Crust) - Main Course

recipes.name: Pork Rind Nachos Supreme
recipes.description: A crunchy and savory keto take on nachos using pork rinds as the base.
ingredients: 1 large bag (3-4 oz) plain pork rinds
1/2 lb ground beef or turkey, cooked and seasoned with keto-friendly taco seasoning
1 cup shredded cheddar or Mexican blend cheese
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) or prepare to use the broiler (watch very carefully under broiler).
Spread the pork rinds in a single layer on a large oven-safe plate or baking sheet.
Sprinkle the cooked and seasoned ground meat evenly over the pork rinds.
Top generously with shredded cheese. Add other bake-friendly toppings like jalapeños or olives now if desired.
Bake for 5-8 minutes, or until the cheese is completely melted and bubbly. If using broiler, it will only take 1-2 minutes – watch constantly to prevent burning.
Remove from oven and let cool for a minute.
Top with desired fresh toppings like diced tomatoes, sour cream, guacamole/avocado, salsa, and cilantro/green onions.
Serve immediately. A fun and customizable snack or light meal for the family.
recipes.notes: Recipe 225 - Pork Rind Nachos Supreme - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Cheese Crisps (Chaffle Method)
recipes.description: Simple, crispy cheese snacks made easily in a mini waffle maker.
ingredients: 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese (or Parmesan, or a mix)
Optional seasonings: 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon Italian herbs
instructions: Preheat your mini waffle maker (chaffle maker).
Place about 1/4 cup of shredded cheese directly onto the hot waffle iron. If using seasonings, sprinkle them over the cheese.
Close the lid and cook for 2-4 minutes, or until the cheese is melted, golden brown, and crispy.
Carefully remove the cheese crisp from the waffle maker using a fork or small spatula.
Let it cool on a wire rack for a minute or two to fully crisp up.
Repeat with the remaining cheese. These are great for dipping or as a crunchy snack.
recipes.notes: Recipe 226 - Cheese Crisps (Chaffle Method) - Appetizers/Snacks

recipes.name: Nut and Seed Trail Mix
recipes.description: A customizable, crunchy, and energy-boosting keto trail mix.
ingredients: 1/2 cup raw almonds, whole or slivered
1/2 cup raw pecans or walnuts, halves or pieces
1/4 cup unsweetened shredded coconut or coconut flakes
Optional: 1 tablespoon hemp hearts or chia seeds
